 The behind-the-scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers, and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools, and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent, and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.
   

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**
 We want to have all sorts of people on our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.
   

  

 Join us today to build Wolt together!

title: Enterprise Account Executive, Trilogy (Remote) - $400,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?
   

  

 If you think most CEOs are full of themselves (and full of other stuff)... keep reading.
   

  

 Here’s a CEO track that requires — and actually rewards — zero experience being a CEO. In this role, you’ll become an incredibly effective, customer-facing CEO in an environment with more than 100 software products.
   

  

 Who You Are
   

  

 You’ve never been a CEO before. Probably because most of the time, “CEO” is just a 3-letter code for “an exhausting hamster wheel of team building and internal operations logistics.” And hopping on that hamster wheel would be a huge waste of your talent and potential.
   

  

 You’re smart. You keep things clear and direct. And while you’ve worked in SaaS for many years, you don’t have a decade of outdated “leadership” learnings to unlearn. You’re ready to be the leader that smart employees like you have been waiting for. This job right here is your launchpad.
   

  

 You're a generative AI power user. You've used ChatGPT, Claude, Bard, or a similar tool to automate previously manual workflows (note: this role does not require a software development background).
   

  

 You should already be well on your way to building a strong personal brand. We believe in the importance of a personal brand, and we’ll help you develop yours. You should understand the benefits and impact of a personal brand, the long-tail nature of content, and the effort it takes.
   

  

 You have experience with quickly moving products, particularly in leadership roles during the launch of epic new features. If you’ve been part of teams going from Seed through Series A/B rounds, that’s a huge plus. You’ve got proven ability to get customers excited about new product features and have used metrics like net dollar retention and win-back rates (and others) to measure the impact of new product features.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Implementing AI-driven Productivity Improvements: Utilizing generative AI tools to streamline and automate various workflows across the company.
* Customer Engagement and Feedback: Interacting with customers to gather insights and feedback, and using this information to enhance product offerings.
* Develop a Personal Monopoly: Publishing podcast episodes and blog posts and building a social media following to evangelize your portfolio's AI-driven products.


**What You Won’t Be Doing**
* Busywork that drains your creativity.
* Day-in, day-out team management or internal operations that distract from your vision.
* Tinker with the business model to figure out what works. (Remember, we’re giving you the playbook.)


**Basic Requirements**
**Enterprise Account Executive key responsibilities**
* At least 8 years of work experience in the enterprise software industry
* Leadership experience in marketing, sales, business development, partnerships, professional services, or another hands-on customer-facing domain
* Experience using generative AI tools to achieve quantifiable productivity improvements
* Currently based in North America, South America, or Europe


**About Trilogy**
 Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with Crossover**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $200 USD/hour, which equates to $400,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

**What to expect next:**
* You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
* Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.


**Important!** 
 If you do not receive an email from us:
   

  

* First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
* Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
* Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
* If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
**Job Purpose**
**Key Accountabilities**
**Key Activities**
**Experience**
**Competencies**
 Accepting Direction
   

  

 Accepting Responsibility
   

  

 Acquiring Information
   

  

 Akzo Nobel Car Refinishes provides coatings and services for collision repairers and commercial vehicle refinishers via the brands Dynacoat, Sikkens and Lesonal. Our Nordic head office is situated in Tyresö. In the the Nordics there is a focus on collision repairs of cars and refinishes for trucks. We are a Nordic organization and belongs to AkzoNobels Vehicle Refinishes, one of the leading suppliers within the commercial car and airplanes industry. Vehicle Refinished head office is located in Sassenheim, Netherlands, where we also have the biggest development, manufacturing, and distribution centers.
   

  

 Are you passionate about customer service? Are you solution-oriented and do you enjoy being a part of a team? Do you want to work in a global company that is very present in the Nordic region in several business areas? We're currently looking for a Customer Service Representative to join our dynamic team in Årsta!
   

  

**What can AkzoNobel offer you?**
 At AkzoNobel you are met by a warm and welcoming atmosphere. We work together with a focus on innovation and sustainability, to be the leader in our industry. Diversity enriches our workplaces, and we work actively together with our employees to make them thrive and develop. We work strategically to become a better employer. This has resulted in that we have been appointed one of Sweden's Karriärföretag and received Top Employer certification 2024. We offer you an international working environment where you take on rewarding and challenging tasks that broaden your horizon and develop you in your role. You will work with competent and like-minded colleagues who share your attitude and enthusiasm. Welcome!
   

  

**What will you do?**
 In your role as Customer Service Representative, you can fully focus on what you enjoy doing the most: handling all customer requests! It is our goal to make sure that our customers are satisfied, and that all their questions and requests are dealt with swiftly and accurately. Your day will be full of surprises, because we live a fast-changing environment and need to adapt constantly to the latest situation. We're looking for someone who likes to work independently but finds it very important to be a team player colleagues can depend on. Your main tasks are:
   

  

* Manage order receipt efficiently, prioritizing timely order processing and good customer interactions and relationships.
* Register and processes customer orders in the ERP system (SAP)
* Act as first level contact with customer for answers to questions
* Register and solve complaints.
* Obtain adequate customer and product knowledge to find solutions for customer needs


 This is a permanent position based in Årsta, Stockholm. You will report to the Customer Service Coordinator for the Nordics.
   

  

  

  

**Who are you?**
 As a person, you like to be in a supportive role where you act as the first contact for our customers to manage various questions. You are a social and service-minded person who always puts the customer in focus. We also believe that you are solution-oriented, patient and have the ability to prioritize among your tasks. You have a flexible attitude to your work and enjoy working in teams. You are also used to work on many topics at the same time.
   

  

 Requirements:
   

  

* You have a customer-oriented attitude, willing to go to extra mile
* You are flexible and able to handle time pressure
* You have a problem-solving mentality
* You are a real team player
* You speak Swedish, Norwegian and English


**Your application**
 At AkzoNobel we are very committed to ensuring an inclusive and respectful workplace where all employees can be their best selves. We strive to embrace diversity, tolerance and respect. Our recruitment process plays a major role in this journey as it lays the foundation for a diverse work environment. In our organization, all qualified applicants are treated from an equal perspective regardless of ethnic origin, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age or disability.
   

  

 For additional information about the vacancy please contact Matti Holopainen, Customer Service Coordinator Nordics, matti.holopainen@akzonobel.com
   

  

 For the information about the recruitment process, please contact Elin Incegül, TA Partner, elin.incegul@akzonobel.com

title: Säkerhetsskyddshandläggare till Sweco!
description:
Har du en bakgrund inom säkerhetskydd och vill ha ett jobb som gör skillnad? Till Sweco som är en helhetsleverantör av tjänster inom säkerhet och skydd, söker vi nu en Säkerhetskyddshandläggare! Läs mer om tjänsten här och skicka in en ansökan redan idag.
 



  

**Företag :**
 SWECO Sverige AB
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 HR/kontor/administration
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Omgående
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
   




**Om tjänsten**

 För Swecos räkning söker vi nu en säkerhetsskyddshandläggare med betoning på säkerhetsprövningar med placering vid deras huvudkontor på Kungsholmen i Stockholm. Avdelningen består av en säkerhetsskyddschef tillika säkerhetschef, en biträdande säkerhetsskyddschef samt två säkerhetsskyddshandläggare.
 


  


 Som säkerhetsskyddshandläggare hos Sweco kommer du få stora möjligheter att utvecklas både personlighets- intresse- och erfarenhetsmässigt, i ett bolag som ständigt utvecklas. Här får du möjlighet att vara en del av företagets arbete med att bistå Swecos kunder i att skydda viktiga funktioner i samhället. Hos Sweco blir du del av ett starkt team som kompletterar och ställer upp för varandra i verksamheten.
 


  


 Tjänsten är ett bemanningsuppdrag via Academic Work som förväntas pågå långsiktigt förutsatt att samarbetet fungerar bra.
   




**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Genomföra och följa upp säkerhetsprövningar
  
* Genomföra personutredningar vid särskilda händelser
  
* Administration i form av säkerhetsskyddsavtal, bakgrundskontroller, ansökan om registerkontroller, utbildningar m.m.
  
* Utveckla, driva och säkerhetställa att säkerhetsskyddet i Sweco efterlevs
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har en avslutad universitetsutbildning inom säkerhet, beteendevetenskap, IT eller liknande
  
* Har intresse för system, IT och säkerhet
  
* Har lätt för att sätta dig in i nya system och arbetssätt
  
* Har mycket goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska då bägge språken används i det dagliga arbetet
  
* Har erfarenhet av arbete inom säkerhetsskydd
  
* Har säkerhetsbakgrund av något slag exempelvis informationssäkerhet, personalsäkerhet eller om du studerat på eftergymnasial nivå inom ämnet
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Ansvarstagande
  
* Stabil
  
* Ordningsam
  
* Intellektuellt nyfiken
  


  


 I den här processen kommer dina personliga egenskaper vara avgörande. För att lyckas i tjänsten är bör du vara driven, trygg, pålitlig och ha hög integritet. Vidare är du noggrann, kvalitetsmedveten och har en välutvecklad analytisk förmåga. Du behöver även ha en god kommunikativ- och pedagogisk förmåga, vilket gör att du skapar förtroende och förståelse till våra medarbetare. För dig är det viktigt att driva uppgifter framåt och i mål.
 


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
 


  


 Går du vidare i processen kommer bakgrundskontroller genomföras som en del av rekryteringsprocessen.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Alina Finnberg eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stn01@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105313

title: Head of Protective Security
description:
**Why Nasdaq**
 When you work at Nasdaq, you’re working for more open and transparent markets so that more people can access opportunities. Connections can be made, jobs can be created, and communities can thrive. We want all our employees to have access to opportunity, too. That means planning for career growth, ensuring you have the tools you need, and promoting an inclusive culture where we’re all valued for our unique perspective.
   

  

 Here, you will work for a global tech leader committed to breaking down barriers to inclusive prosperity. We see technology as a means to free people up to work together more productively and effectively by centralizing data, analytics, and market intelligence.
   

  

 Here, we’re committed to building a more diverse and inclusive workforce. Not only is it our responsibility to do better, but we also need representative voices to power the fresh thinking that is vital for our business and our clients.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 Nasdaq is a leading financial institution dedicated to maintaining the highest standards of compliance with regulation and operational excellence. We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Head of Protective Security for Nasdaq Stockholm AB to ensure compliance with Swedish Protective Security Law. The Head of Protective Security will lead and organize the effort of maintaining and developing protective security, reporting directly to CEO, for Nasdaq Stockholm AB.
   

  

 You can expect an autonomous but fast-paced work environment where you are recognized for your results and ability to drive things forward. Every day brings many opportunities to learn & grow and rewards with a global impact we create. In return, you will receive a competitive salary package, incredible health and financial wellbeing benefits, paid vacation and parental leave, paid flex days, strong pension package, and more.
   

  

 Join us and play a crucial role in maintaining the integrity and quality of our regulatory processes!
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Lead and organize the effort of maintaining and developing protective security for Nasdaq Stockholm AB.
* Ensure compliance with Swedish Protective Security law and Protective Security Ordinance.
* Reporting directly to CEO of Nasdaq Stockholm AB, you will be collaborating closely with our Nordic CISO, compliance and risk management.
* As Head of Protective Security for Nasdaq Stockholm, you hold the overarching responsibility for the protective security effort both strategically and operationally.
* You develop plans, coordinate with stakeholders and audit performance, train staff and revise plans and assessments as required. You will lead efforts to adapt and align internal frameworks to dovetail with Protective Security.
* The role is identified as a Risk Taker role.


**What We Expect**
* Background in financial industry
* 12+ years of professional experience within compliance, risk or information security, of which 3+ years within protective security and 5+ years within leadership roles
* The role requires preventative, long term, systematic and goal oriented approach to protective security. To be successful you need to be structured and detail oriented.
* Experience preparing material for boards and C-level executives
* Experience engaging with regulators
* Strong interpersonal skills
* Fluent in Swedish and English, both written and verbal
* Swedish Citizenship is a requirement
* Drivers License type B is a requirement


**Does this sound like you?**
 To be successful in this role, you should be comfortable delivering to a complex organization and working with senior stakeholders. This role will require strong collaboration and coordination, as well as problem solving skills. The ideal candidate is structured and detailed, as well as result-oriented and great at execution. We anticipate that you are a self-motivated and a positive person who is pro-active, demonstrates initiative and enjoys a fast pace working environment. The role requires security clearance (Säkerhetsprövning), final candidate will therefore need to pass security authorization in addition to background check before extending an offer.
   

  

 If this sparked your interest then submit your application as soon as possible, as the process is ongoing. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

**Come as You Are**
**Nasdaq is an equal opportunity employer. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of age, color, disability, national origin, ancestry, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable law.**
**We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.**

title: Sr Director, Centralized Monitoring
description:
***This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.***
 Work Schedule
   

  

 Standard (Mon-Fri)
   

  

 Environmental Conditions
   

  

 Office
   

  

**Job Description**
*At Thermo Fisher Scientific, you'll discover meaningful work that makes a positive impact on a global scale. Join our colleagues in bringing our Mission to life - enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We provide our teams with the resources needed to achieve individual career goals while taking science a step beyond through research, development and delivery of life-changing therapies. With clinical trials conducted in 100+ countries and ongoing development of novel frameworks for clinical research through our PPD clinical research portfolio, our work spans laboratory, digital and decentralized clinical trial services. Your determination to deliver quality and accuracy will improve health outcomes that people and communities depend on - now and in the future.*
**The Job**
 As Senior Director, Centralized Monitoring, you'll provide operational and strategic leadership for the development and delivery of Risk Based Quality Management (RBQM) strategy and centralized monitoring objectives. You will be responsible for directing, leading, and managing your assigned team to successfully complete CM deliverables in support of clients and studies. Your role will involve training, management, and mentorship within the department, as well as collaborative outreach to adjacent departments and functions.
   

  

**Our Organisation**
*Our global Clinical Operations colleagues within our PPD® clinical research services provide end-to-end support for clinical trials from study start up to monitoring through to study close out, across commercial and government contracts. Together, we help clients define and develop clinical programs, minimize delays, and implement high-quality, cost-efficient clinical studies.*
 What will you do?
   

  

* Serve as a Subject Matter Expert in Risk Based Quality Management (RBQM) methodologies, tools, processes, and central monitoring methods
* Develop and manage client and partner relationships, mentoring and directing staff and management, including overseeing and ensuring quality of RBQM and data strategy at the project and program level
* Drive risk assessment and define mitigations and proper monitoring strategy for critical data and processes
* Drive policy development and support implementation of broader goals by working across departments
* Supervise and coordinate centralized monitoring client risk and data strategy delivery
* Ensure the CM teams are provided with the necessary support and resources
* Manage staff and management, including interviewing, professional development, and performance management
* Lead internal and cross-functional initiatives, including process and tool development
* Contribute to future strategy and vision for CM and Clinical Operations


**Who We Are Looking For**
* Knowledge of broad drug development process and expertise in cross functional adoption of Risk Based Quality Management
* Knowledge of industry regulatory and clinical standards such as ICH E6 & E8
* 15+ years of previous experience within Pharma or CRO organisations, providing the knowledge, skills, and abilities to perform the job
* Extensive prior management responsibility
* Advanced level of business English


**What's In It For You**
 We offer competitive remuneration, annual incentive plan bonus, healthcare, and a range of employee benefits. Thermo Fisher Scientific offers employment with an innovative, forward-thinking organization, and outstanding career and development prospects. We offer an exciting company culture that stands for integrity, intensity, involvement, and innovation!

title: Expert IT Architect, Credit Risk/Workflow/Collateral
description:
**Job ID: 22733** 






  
 





 Would you like to grab a challenging and exciting opportunity to shape the future of Nordea’s Credit Risk & Collateral Domain in Group Architecture? We are now looking for an Expert IT Architect to provide architectural support and direction across the enterprise.
 





  
 





 At Nordea, we know our customers’ needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We’re creating an agile environment where we’re harnessing the power of technology – one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger.  
 





  
 





**About the role** 






  
 





 The Credit & Collateral Architecture team is expanding and seeking experienced an Expert IT Architect to help define the target architecture vision for the domain and conceptualise the same in transitional steps that can then be delivered through working software across the full SDLC. This manifest itself in the ability to govern, mentor and overseeing the design and implementation work managed through other architecture / engineering resources and developers. You will work as a trusted business advisor and help shaping the strategy, develop technology implementation options, and engineer solutions that achieve the business and technology objectives.
 





  

  



**Primary Responsibilities:** 





* Lead and manage the credit risk domain projects through all phases of the project lifecycle from defining the strategic roadmap with business, developing the technology blueprint, planning the phased IT implementation, setting up the team and the governance structures related to the production rollout /project activities.
* Ability to translate strategic goals through transitional delivery steps, even if that implies justified technical debt to achieve the business outcome.
* Lead Credit Risk and Collateral domain project with blended onshore/offshore teams that range in size from 5 to 25 team members.
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders across all business touch points in the domain related to channel integration, pricing, analytics, decisioning, debt collection, scoring and risk modelling.
* In-depth and experienced understanding of operational credit risk functions and capabilities in context of lending products and services in banking and /or insurance.
* Influence the business and technology direction at the divisional or enterprise level based on broad expertise across multiple software platforms and technologies.
* Conduct "Whiteboard", knowledge and requirements gathering sessions with clients through the conceptualisation, design and implementation of new systems, middleware/API, and business intelligence solutions/ reporting solutions.​





 You’ll join a team of experienced architects. The role is based in Helsinki; Gdańsk; Gdynia; Stockholm; Warszawa.
 





  
 





**Who you are** 







*Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage.* 
 These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  
 




**To succeed in this role, we believe that you have:** 





* Ability to communicate technical concepts in simple terms; must be comfortable presenting solution design concepts and guiding solution design discussions / sessions.
* Ability to work independently, as well as guide and mentor other team members, partners and customers.
* Strong executive presence and ability to interact with senior executives.
* Candidates should be flexible / willing to work across this delivery landscape which includes, but is not limited to only SAFe.





**Qualifications:** 





* 10+ years of related work experience in the areas related to the Credit Risk domain i.e. Collateral Management, Debt Collection, Default Management, Risk Modelling, Regulatory Reporting, Decisioning, Scoring, Rating, Data Governance, Business Intelligence and/or Data Warehousing.
* A minimum of 5+ years’ experience in a client-facing consulting delivery role managing in an onsite / offshore delivery model with emphasis on collaborative working through use of virtual teams.



  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than
 



 15/08/2024
 



 . For more information about the position please contact Hiring Leader Shabbir Contractor at shabbir.contractor@nordea.com.
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 





  
 





 Only for candidates in Sweden - for union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.
 





  
 





 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.
 





  
 





 Only for candidates in Poland: Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following: 
 





  
 





 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. 
 





  
 





 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: https://www.nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf.
 





  
 





 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: Manager Export Logistics
description:
**ABOUT US** 




  





 The Absolut Group (TAG) holds global responsibility for the production, packaging development, innovation and strategic marketing of an extensive range of premium spirits brands. They include the iconic Absolut Vodka, Beefeater, the world’s most awarded gin, Malibu, the leading flavoured rum and Kahlua, the number one coffee liqueur, along with a selection of agave spirits, including Altos tequila and craft gins such as Monkey 47. Headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, The Absolut Group is part of Pernod Ricard, a worldwide leader in the spirits and wine industry.
 



  





 We strive to redefine the global spirit market and the world we live in by inspiring people of all backgrounds to come together to mix ideas and drinks, respectfully and responsibly. And we have a true long-term commitment to sustainability – doing the right thing for consumers, society, the environment and our people.
 



  





 We are always on the lookout for talented individuals to join our team and help us shake things up. We believe that work should be more than a paycheck, so whether you are just starting your career or looking to take it to the next level, we offer a dynamic and supportive work environment that will help you grow. Come join us and let’s raise a glass to a fulfilling career and a bright future at The Absolut Group!
 



  





 The Absolut Group Customer Services Department is looking for a Manager Export Logistics at the Customer Service department, that would like to take part in the process of shipping Absolut and Malibu brands to the world.
 



  





  





**ABOUT THE ROLE** 




  





 The Customer Service (CS) Department within TAG handles all customer orders from “order to cash” globally, with customers in 126 countries. We are key stake holders in the process of executing the company’s annual plan and possess and share the core knowledge of exporting and shipping alcohol over the world. Our brands are premium products, and we are expected to provide excellent customer service to our markets and partners.
 



  





 We are today a great team of 12 dedicated and professional people located at our head office in Stockholm. We are now looking for a new talent to join our team!
 



  





 Key responsibilities and activities:
 


* Responsible for selected market: handling orders and communicate very closely with the market companies
* Issue export documents and make sure TAG fulfil all legal requirements regarding export/import regulation
* Ensure a daily contact with transport carriers to ensure that our products reach markets in a timely manner
* Secure a daily contact with the Supply Chain team in our factory for Absolut vodka in Åhus regarding planning, executing shipments and loading
* Co-operate closely with Manzanares, the warehouse in Spain, regarding Malibu & Kahlúa
* Managing invoices and EMCS (movement of excise goods)



  





  





**ABOUT YOU** 




  





 You are passionate about Logistics and Customer Service, and have minimum 3 years of experience in international trade and shipping. Customer experience is your priority, and you are a true team player.
 



  





 You are also:
 


* A specialist of customs procedures, import/export
* Methodical, flexible and solution oriented
* Open-minded with a can-do attitude, and high social skills
* Fluent in spoken and written in English



  





  





**OUR OFFER** 




  





*At The Absolut Group, we are the thinking and doing of all our brilliant people. Be audacious and to go after your dreams right from the start – and you will thrive in a passionate and progressive environment where we collaborate across borders. Be committed to a sustainable supply chain, a safe, inclusive workplace, and a responsible consumer culture, and we can achieve real change together.* 




  





*With our spirit of belonging, we create a culture of what we call convivialité. It’s the magic of human connections that makes things happen. You are welcome to The Absolut Group for who you are. We believe that an inclusive workplace with diversity of experiences and perspectives creates a vibrant work environment and mirrors our global consumers.* 




  





*Read more about us at* 
 Careers | The Absolut Group (theabsolutcompany.com)
 



  





  





  





**APPLICATION** 




 If this role resonates with you, don’t hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!
 



  





 For more information about the position, please feel free to contact Charlotte Åhman at charlotte.ahman@pernod-ricard.com, or about the process please contact Eléna Mennrath, Talent Acquisition Specialist (elena.mennrath-ext@pernod-ricard.com). We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis, so please send your application as soon as possible.
 



 Please note that due to summer break, the process could be longer than usual!

title: Senior DevOps
description:
*Redpill Linpro är ledande specialister inom open source och brinner för öppna lösningar, öppna affärsmodeller och ett öppet samhälle. Tillsammans samverkar vi för att uppnå maximal nytta för alla. Hos oss finns några av marknadens främsta experter inom sina specialområden. Vi är omkring 300 anställda och du finner oss i tre länder på sex kontor: Stockholm, Göteborg, Karlstad, Linköping samt i Köpenhamn och Oslo.*
**Arbetsbeskrivning**
 Vi söker erfarna DevOps-utvecklare som vill stötta upp våra team och arbeta i en av Nordens tyngsta Linux-miljöer. Tillsammans med riktig vassa kollegor kommer du ta del av spännande kundprojekt och utveckla framtidens lösningar. För dig som har erfarenhet av, eller ett intresse för att utvecklas in i en ledande roll och driva team framåt så erbjuds även denna möjlighet.
   

  

**Du kommer exempelvis arbeta med:**
* Systemdrift, arkitektur och code review
* Automatisera arbetsflöden med CI/CD i Git och Jenkins
* Containerteknologer såsom Docker, Kubernetes och OpenShift
* Molnbaserade lösningar såsom AWS, Azure eller OpenStack
* Scriptspråk så som shell script, Ruby och Python
* PostgreSQL/MySQL, Nginx, Varnish och Apache
* Konfigurering i Puppet och Ansible


**Vem är du?**
 För att trivas som konsult hos oss har du ett stort teknikintresse och en vilja att utvecklas inom nya områden och i ny teknik. Du drivs av problemlösning och förstår att det är samarbete som för oss framåt.
   

  

**Utöver ovanstående kompetenser ser vi att du har:**
* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom relaterat område
* Några års erfarenhet av DevOps-utveckling
* Erfarenhet av en eller flera av ovanstående teknologier
* Du har mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska


**Meriterande:**
* Vi ser gärna att du har en bred Linux-grund och har labbat runt med flera distributörer
* Erfarenhet av automatisering och/eller Cloud
* Erfarenhet av infrastruktur som kod (IaC) och GitOps


**Varför Redpill Linpro?**
* Du får arbeta med några av de allra mest begåvade IT-talangerna i en organisation som brinner för professionella Open Source-ideal
* Du får arbeta med spännande projekt i flera olika branscher: allt från startups till globala jättar och myndigheter där du får vara med och göra skillnad på riktigt!
* Du får trevliga chefer som för en bra personalpolitik - våra konsulter är våra superstars och prioriteras alltid först
* Du får arbeta med den senaste tech-stacken och alltid vara up-to-date med ny teknologi
* Du får ta del av fördelarna att arbeta på ett medelstort nordiskt bolag med go sammanhållning, bra förmåner och där du ges stor frihet och flexibilitet i ditt arbete


 Önskar du att bli en del av vårt team? Tveka inte att höra av dig. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Redpill Linpro is the leading provider of Open Source services and products in the Nordics. We are located in Oslo, Stockholm, Gothenburg, Karlstad Linköping, Copenhagen, Aarhus, and Trondheim with a mission to share knowledge and best practices for a more open society.
   

  

 We are passionate about open solutions, open business models, and an open society where we work together for maximum benefit to everyone. We have got some really skilled co-workers here at Redpill Linpro, particularly within our main areas: API management, development, IT operations, data analytics, customer experience, cloud, DevOps, and automation.
   

  

**May the Source be with you!**

title: Experienced Product Owner for Open Banking in Customer and Sector Integrations Tribe
description:
**Job Description**
 Do you want to drive the future of how we integrate with customers and 3 rd parties to offer the next generation of banking solutions? Do you get a kick when the answer is not always straightforward and the strategic impact is high?
   

  

 In the Customer and Sector Integrations Tribe, we enable customers to streamline their banking experience by automating communication of financial interactions and data between the customers, Danske Bank, the financial sector, and authorities. We are around 100 colleagues located across the Nordics, Lithuania, and India.
   

  

**Your mission:**
* Develop our Open Banking offering to enable the next generation of how we integrate with customers and 3 rd parties
* Enable customers and 3 rd parties to easily onboard and utilize our Open Banking offering via a high degree of self-service
* Ensure that our Open Banking platform is highly available, scalable, stable and resilient


 We are looking for a skilled Product Owner to be part of driving our Open Banking offering that consists of both regulatory APIs (PSD2) and Premium APIs.
   

  

 As a Product Owner, you will be a vital part of setting the direction for our Open Banking offering, that is a key element in our Forward 28’ strategy. You will be responsible for understanding and exploring WHAT our customers need and translate that into to tangible deliverables and increments in collaboration with your squad.
   

  

 Depending on your experience and knowledge, we may offer you different seniority of the role.
   

  

**You will:**
* Set the direction for our Open Banking offering
* Build a roadmap and prioritise the backlog
* Actively engage in commercial opportunities and customer dialogues
* Drive and take key decisions on both high and detailed level
* Create a conducive and collaborative environment through effective leadership
* Ensure effective communication between the squad and stakeholders


**About you:**
* At least 5 years of experience working as a Product Owner or relevant experience from Project Management, Consultancy, Sales, or Business Analysis background
* Good at spotting commercial opportunities
* Proven interpersonal and leadership abilities
* Collaborator by heart with good communication and storytelling skills
* Enjoy complexity with the ability to make complex matters simple
* Thrive in making decisions and not afraid to step forward
* Solution-oriented and good at solving problems
* Upper-intermediate English skills


*We would consider as a bonus:*
* Experience working within IT Development and or/Financial Services
* Educational background within IT, Math, or Economics


*"We celebrate multiple approaches and points of view. We believe diversity drives innovation."*
**This position can be located in Denmark, Finland, Norway, Sweden and Lithuania.**
**If the position is located in Lithuania, the salary range will be** 
 from 5200 EUR to 7800 EUR gross (based on your competencies relevant for the job).
   

  

 Additionally, each Danske Bank employee in Lithuania receives employee benefits package which includes:
   

  

* Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.
* Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
* Hybrid working conditions: home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
* Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
* Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.


**See all the benefits** 
**HERE** 
**.**
 Your title in job contract will be Squad Leader (Product Owner).
   

  

**If you have questions about the role, please contact Chapter Lead for Product Owners in Customer and Sector Integrations Tribe:**
**Thorbjørn Tavs Søndergaard**
**thsn@danskebank.dk**
 #DK
   

  

 #FI
   

  

 #SE
   

  

 #NO
   

  

**About Us**
 Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

title: Global Relationship Manager
description:
At HSBC, our purpose is opening up a world of opportunity and by joining our team, you can be part of something bigger. We are committed to removing barriers and ensuring careers at HSBC are inclusive and accessible.
 



  





**What you will do:** 




  





 The role holder will have the freedom to support the expansion of the CMB franchise in Nordics by proposing and pursuing new initiatives under the guidance of the Senior Relationship Manager and the country leadership team.
 



  





**In this role you will:** 




  




* Deliver an outstanding ‘client experience’ to our customers through a client-centric approach by taking ownership, navigating HSBC, being proactive and responsive.
* Build longstanding, personal and trusted relationships with existing/new clients and develop a profound strategic- and flow business dialogue.
* Be a credible and a high-profile ambassador for HSBC Nordics with our clients and third party stakeholders and by further growing the bank in the Nordic Large Corporate market by attending external business events, seminars and prospects.
* Work collaboratively with product partners and colleagues to execute tailored client plan strategies, increase share of wallet and capture cross border opportunities. Showcase good risk-reward judgement origination of new business and optimize overall relationship returns.
* Ensure integrity and fairness in all aspect of work, including sales process/customer treatment, and demonstrate role model behavior with respect to open feedback culture, inclusiveness/diversity, team engagement, and HSBC’s core values.
* Coach, inspire and motivate junior colleagues and proactively share knowledge, experience and best practices, taking a genuine interest in their progression.
* Provide high quality credit risk proposals showing thorough understanding of your clients and the industries in which they operate, and build a trusted working relationship with Risk, including the timely identification of potential credit issues and periodic credit monitoring.
* Deliver and negotiate credit facility documentation with clients.
* Ensure high standards of operational quality, and take first line of defense responsibility with respect to the management of credit, operational, reputational, compliance and regulatory risks.
* Ensure timely and accurate maintenance of customer information, including KYC requirements, and ensure internal systems are accurately updated, whilst protecting sensitive customer data.



  





**You should apply if you have:** 




  




* A minimum of 10-15 years of relevant large corporate banking experience
* A degree in a relevant discipline (Finance, Accounting, etc) or a similar qualification
* Recognize yourself in the following: client focused, proactive, hands-on, can do mentality, responsive, no-nonsense, collaborative, service-minded, engaged, integrity, empathic, problem solving, focus on detail, enthusiastic, inspiring, doing the right thing. You live the core HSBC values: take responsibility, succeed together, value difference and get it done.
* relevant work experience in a similar client facing position with comprehensive international needs and knowledge of Commercial Banking (Lending, Cash Management, Trade, FX) / Global Banking & Markets (DCM, ECM, M&A) products and services.
* A strong intrinsic motivation to serve clients, with an entrepreneurial spirit and a drive to surpass customers’ needs, solving problems with flair and a tenacity to thrive through results.
* A proven track record to develop a client portfolio and acquire new clients at C-suite level
* High level of business acumen and adaptation of commercial/risk awareness
* A passion for working in an international environment with a good understanding of economic, cultural, procedural and regulatory matters.
* Excellent financial- and business analysis skills
* Proven ability in managing complex credit risk processes and a vast experience in negotiating comprehensive credit documentation (syndicated and bilateral).
* Excellent interpersonal skills with a particular emphasis on inspiring people and interacting with customers and colleagues.
* Excellent communication skills (both verbal/in writing) as well as the ability to deliver compelling presentations
* A strong network in the Nordic Large Corporate market or an ability to quickly develop one from a proven track record in another market as well as sector knowledge
* Speaking and writing well in English is critical, speaking and writing a Nordic language is an advantage.



  





**What you’ll get in return:** 




  





 Not only is HSBC a great place to work, but we also offer the following unique and exciting opportunities and benefits:
 



  





 We’ll help you progress your career, including access to development programmes, mentoring and coaching, as well as world-class training through HSBC University
 


* You can work your way and will have a say in when, where and how you and your team flexibly work together
* Our benefits will give you financial security, and can include Pension fund, Insurance cover, wellness allowance.
* We’ll give you a huge range of resources that support your mental, physical and social well-being.
* You’ll have opportunities to work internationally - this can be your place to start and branch out to anywhere we have offices
* You’ll be able to join our Employee Resource Groups that bring together colleagues with shared characteristics and common interests.

title: Business Controller to Henkel
description:
Join Henkel as a Business Controller and be part of a global leader renowned for innovation and excellence. With well known brands and cutting-edge technologies, you'll play a essential role in driving business growth in the Nordics!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**Company :**
 Henkel Norden Aktiebolag
 



  

**City :**
 Office located in Sundbyberg, Stockholm.
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Finance / Law / Purchase
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 According to agreement
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Recruitment
 



  

**Other :**
 Possibility to work remote
   




**About the role**

 Henkel, a leader in both industrial and consumer sectors, is dedicated to innovation and improving life every day. Join Henkel’s global community of 50,000 pioneers who thrive on challenging the norm. With well known brands, cutting-edge technologies, and disruptive solutions, Henkel offers endless opportunities to explore new paths and develop your skills.
   

 Immerse yourself in Henkel’s diverse and inclusive culture, and contribute to sustainable growth.
   

**As a Business Controller**
 , you'll support Henkel's expanding Consumer Brands division in the Nordics, featuring brands like Barnängen, Schwarzkopf, Igora, and Osis.
   




**Work tasks**
  
* Actively support the Nordic General Manager and sales team in driving business development and achieving targets as a key member of the SBU management team.
  
* Provide detailed financial analysis to proactively highlight risks and opportunities and their financial impact.
  
* Develop a good understanding of brand, market and category performance and provide analysis that will help deliver the short & long term business strategy.
  
* Work closely with the controlling organization for Cluster North (Nordics & UK/Ireland) and report to the Head of Controlling at our Sundbyberg office.
  
* Ensure fast, timely, and reliable reporting for the assigned Business Unit, adhering to monthly closing and reporting deadlines.
  
* Ensure compliance with Henkel’s Corporate Standards and relevant laws and regulations.
  
* Be part of a dynamic global organization with opportunities for career development regionally and globally.
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Degree in Finance and Accounting.
  
* Proven experience in Business Controlling or Financial Planning & Analysis.
  
* Strong IT skills (Excel, BI tools); SAP knowledge is a plus.
  
* Proficiency in both Swedish and English, as you will engage with these languages extensively in your everyday work. Working knowledge of Finnish is a plus.
  


  


 At Henkel, we embrace a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of our employees is our strength. In this recruitment process, in addition to your qualifications, we will place great emphasis on your personal qualities and suitability for the role To thrive in this role, you should demonstrate strong organizational skills, a keen analytical mindset, and excellent communication abilities. Moreover, you enjoy working in a diverse international organization and collaborating with stakeholders across Europe and are ambitious and able to independently drive projects.
 


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work. The responsible recruitment consultant is Milly ( milly.weidstam@academicwork.se ) and recruitment coordinator Stina ( stina.moby@academicwork.se ).
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Henkel Norden Aktiebolag**

 Read more about Henkel here: This is Henkel
   




**Get directly recruited to Henkel Norden Aktiebolag**

 When you apply to this application, you will get hired by our partner. This means that you can relax while we take care of the application process.
   




**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Milly Ellqvist Weidstam or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on stv3@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15106059

title: Stödassistent
description:
Stockholm – vår huvudstad med miljoner drömmar, förväntningar och ambitioner. Vi jobbar för alla som lever här idag och i framtiden. Nu söker vi dig som vill tänka stort, nytt och annorlunda med oss – för stockholmarna.
   

  

 Vill du göra skillnad i Stockholmarnas vardag, och ingå i en spännande och växande stadsdel? Hos oss får du utvecklas och växa med uppgiften tillsammans med kunniga kollegor i en miljö med bra balans mellan arbete och fritid. Ett gott bemötande och jämlikhet är viktigt för oss. Våra värdeord ansvar, tillgänglighet och mod hjälper oss att ständigt utveckla våra arbetssätt och metoder. Tillsammans arbetar vi för att Enskede-Årsta-Vantör ska vara ett tryggt stadsdelsområde att växa upp, leva- och åldras i.
   

  

**Arbetsplatsbeskrivning**
 Arbetet på Rågsveds daglig verksamhet LSS, styrs av individens behov av stöd och service i de aktiviteter som används för att nå målet som individen upprättat för insatsen.
   

  

 Verksamheten arbetar med tydliggörande och struktur. Ledorden är att ”vara steget före”, vilket innebär att arbeta förebyggande så att den enskilde har de bästa förutsättningarna för att lyckas.
   

  

 Arbetet innebär att vara stöd i aktiviteter. Man är alltid två personal som arbetar med en person med speciella behov.
   

  

**Arbetsbeskrivning**
 I arbetet används ett pedagogiskt förhållningssätt genom att utgå från personens intressen, färdigheter och specifika svårigheter, för att skapa förutsättningar till en tillvaro där personens färdigheter används och svårigheter kompenseras. Det betyder att du anpassar ditt bemötande, ditt förhållningssätt och miljön för personen som har funktionsnedsättning.
   

  

 För att möjliggöra aktivitet i det dagliga livet används kognitiva hjälpmedel, AKK och andra för individen specifika hjälpmedel.
   

  

 För att säkerställa kvalitet i de insatser som genomförs, arbetar personal målinriktat med handlingsplaner och metoder som redskap i det dagliga arbetet. Individuella genomförandeplaner upprättas utifrån beställning och dokumentation av arbete sker i social journal.
   

  

 De handlingsplaner, rutiner och scheman som upprättas för individens dagliga arbete är styrande i verksamheten.
   

  

 Med stöd av din kollega samverkar du med, för brukarna, viktiga kontakter.
   

  

 Förutom det direkta arbetet med brukarna utför du också övriga uppgifter som behövs för att verksamheten ska fungera.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi söker dig som har utbildning inom vård och omsorg, inom pedagogiskt eller socialt arbete. Eller utbildning som arbetsgivaren bedömer är likvärdig.
   

  

 God datorvana samt intresse och kunskap om tydliggörande pedagogik är meriterande
   

  

 Du har erfarenhet av arbete med personer med autism, intellektuell och/ eller neuropsykiatrisk funktionsnedsättning. Du har arbetat målinriktat med metoder såsom AKK, tydliggörande pedagogik och lågaffektivt bemötande. Arbete med att strukturera individuella bild/text schema för att tydliggöra dagen. Du har också erfarenhet av dokumentation.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som är initiativtagande, serviceinriktad och stabil. Du är lojal, flexibel och har lätt för att samarbeta med andra.
   

  

 Du har god förmåga att planera, strukturera och prioritera i det dagliga arbetet.
   

  

 Du kommunicerar med andra på ett tydligt och pedagogiskt sätt.
   

  

 Arbetet förutsätter att du kan uttrycka dig väl i både tal och skrift på svenska samt att du har datorkunskaper och kan arbeta med bildhantering tex widget. IT och smart teknik är en självklar del i arbetet.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Intervjuer och tillsättning sker löpande utifrån att erforderliga beslut fattas.
   

  

 Stockholms stad arbetar med kompetensbaserad rekrytering som syftar till att se till varje persons kompetens och därmed motverka diskriminering.
   

  

 Enskede Årsta Vantör är en av 11 stadsdelsförvaltningar i Stockholms stad. Som en del av Stockholms stad erbjuder förvaltningen förskola och fritid, omsorg om äldre och funktionsnedsatta, socialtjänst, förebyggande och trygghetsskapande arbete, stadsutveckling och parkskötsel till våra 105 000 stockholmare som bor i stadsdelsområdet. Vi står inför spännande utmaningar när Enskede Årsta Vantörs stadsdelsområde växer och helt nya stadsdelar byggs. Cirka 18 000 nya lägenheter planeras till år 2030.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Enskede Årsta Vantör SDF | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/4004 | Kontakt: Veronica Liffner 0850820312, | Facklig företrädare: Nina Vastad, Kommunal 08-50820733, | Publicerat: 2024-07-26 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-08-09

title: Advisor | Global Compliance Services
description:
Are you ready to take the next step in your career? Do you have a solid understanding of, and a passion for, creating value through accounting and financial reporting? Would you love to work in a community of solvers together with some of Sweden's top advisors and specialists? Come and join us at PwC!
   

  

**Become a part of PwC's Financial Reporting's Global Compliance Service**
 We are looking for junior and more experienced advisors to join our team of Financial Reporting’s Global Compliance Services (GCS) practice. The positions are roles within our group that specialises in supporting global clients with their Swedish subsidiaries’ statutory accounting obligations (including their annual reports). The practice blends our combination of practical and technical subject matter expertise in preparing statutory Swedish financial statements for our clients. We also help with Group to Swedish GAAP reconciliations as well as proactively supporting throughout our clients’ audit processes. Our multinational clients range from global leaders to mid-tier and smaller groups across a wide range of industry sectors.
   

  

 Depending on your previous experience, you will either act as an engagement member or as an engagement manager. The engagement member is responsible for preparing the work, while the engagement manager is responsible for supporting the engagement members and reviewing their work.
   

  

**In your role as engagement member, your typical day includes:**
* Supporting the engagement manager with engagement planning (including internal risk management activities)
* Preparing Swedish statutory reports (including data collection)
* Preparing and/or reviewing GAAP adjustments in order to ensure compliance with Swedish GAAP
* Having frequent interaction with clients and the PwC network
* Taking responsibility for planning and completing your tasks in a timely manner
* Working closely with the engagement manager to ensure efficient project progress


**In your role as engagement manager, your primary responsibilities will include:** 
  

  

* Up-front scoping and engagement planning
* Ensure engagement compliance with PwC risk management policies
* Reviewing Swedish statutory reports (including data collection) and GAAP analyses in order to ensure compliance with local laws/regulations
* Having frequent interaction and coordinate with clients and the PwC network
* Identifying opportunities to further support our clients with related PwC services and helping clients to manage their accounting risks
* Organising, monitoring and managing projects to ensure on-time and on-budget delivery
* Work with leadership on:
+ Overall project statuses
+ Budget compliance/management
+ Participating in proposals for potential new clients


**Your profile**
 We’re looking for someone who has hands-on experience from accounting and Swedish financial reporting (both K3 and K2), as well as understanding of finance reporting processes. You are able to plan, execute and prioritise projects where the scope of the project and time plan may change several times. You have high social skills and appreciate a role where international relationship building and trust are central.
   

  

**To succeed in this role, we expect you to have:**
* Bachelor’s degree in Economics
* Proficiency in spoken and written English and Swedish
* 2-5 year previous experience from hands-on working with Swedish GAAP
* Experience of preparing and/or reviewing financial reports in accordance with Swedish GAAP
* Demonstrated ability to drive and coordinate projects
* Great skills of Microsoft Excel


**It’s An Advantage If You Have** 
  

  

* Previous experience from working on a larger international accounting firm
* Previous experience from working in an international network setting (e.g. to work across borders and cultures)
* Previous experience from working with IFRS and/or US GAAP
* Great skills in:
+ G Suite and/or MS Office
+ Capego


**It Is a Significant Advantage If You Have**
* Previous experience from working with financial reporting outsourcing projects for international clients
* Previous experience working within the Financial Reporting module of Workiva


**What We Offer You**
 A career in Financial Reporting’s GCS practice will provide you with the opportunity to, together with some of Sweden's top advisors and specialists, deliver value to clients by supporting their accounting function and helping them solve practical problems. PwC's unique offering to our clients is that we function as a one-stop shop, bringing e.g. accounting, financial reporting, compliance, valuation and tax expertise to the table in one go.
   

  

**Does it all sound good to you? We’re looking forward to your application!**
**Please Submit a Complete Application Including**
* CV
* Cover letter where you describe what motivates you in this field


 Your application can be written in either Swedish or English. Since we are continuously reviewing the applications please apply as soon as possible.
 **During weeks 28 to 33, we do not process any applications due to holiday periods. You will therefore receive feedback on your application no earlier than W.33.**
 Read more about who we are, and how we are safeguarding inclusion and diversity through our recruiting at www.pwc.se/karriar.
   

  

 Do you have any questions regarding this position please contact Maria Liljegren, maria.liljegren@pwc.com , do you have any questions regarding the recruitment process please contact Klara Ekberg, klara.ekberg@pwc.com .
   

  

**Recruitment process** 
 We believe in the strength of having a recruitment process that applies to everyone. As part of the selection, we use psychometric tests to ensure an objective, unbiased, and fair selection.
   

  

 We value the personal meeting to understand the value you can bring to PwC and what we can offer you. The interview process usually consists of multiple stages and various types of interviews. During the interview with the business, you will have the opportunity to meet with the relevant team to discuss the role. When meeting with HR, you will have a competency-based interview where we examine the personality test you completed before the interview.

title: Senior Legal Counsel - Payments Specialist
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
**About The Role**
 Due to our continued growth, we’re now looking for a Senior Legal Counsel specialised in payments to join our high performing team. You will work closely with our payments teams in order to assist in all legal matters related to the engagement of, and maintaining business relationships with all of our payment service providers.
   

  

**YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:**
* Drafting, reviewing and negotiating contracts with our payment providers, for a variety of different payment related products (such as card acquirers, electronic money wallets, payment gateways, open banking solutions etc ).
* Working with the payments team and other relevant stakeholders to create and implement new processes related to the onboarding of payment providers, and to iterate over and improve existing processes, identifying gaps and opportunities for optimization.
* Assist with and advise on any disputes with or legal proceedings involving PSPs working with our internal litigation team as well as external counsel.
* Ensuring appropriate recording keeping setups in respect of legal documentation related to Payment Providers (contracts, due diligence documents etc).
* Assessing and advising the business on risks related to the use of payment methods or setups (in various jurisdictions), specific payment providers or contracts and working with our AML Risk Governance and Compliance teams in relation to such risks.
* Identifying any existing and historical legal risks related to payments, and implement appropriate remedial and mitigation measures.
* Providing internal training in relation to laws and best practices related to payment provider contracts.
* Monitoring the regulatory landscape as it relates to payment services in all territories in which LeoVegas Group accepts customers and ensuring key stakeholders in the business are updated and informed of developments.


****OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE:
   

  

 Essential skills:****
* A law degree in an EU jurisdiction, however a masters level degree is preferred;
* 5 to 7 years of previous experience in a similar role (or roles) (experience with a payment services provider whom services the gambling industry is preferred);
* In-depth knowledge and expertise on laws and regulations related to payment services (including all relevant EU Payment Services Directives and other EU legislation).
* Evidence of extensive experience drafting and negotiating contracts for payment services, and detailed understanding of the relevant legal principles underlying such contracts. ;
* Able to follow through all assigned tasks and projects to completion independently, and also to take direction and also take full ownership of the responsibilities assigned.


 Nice to have skills:
   

  

* Knowledge of and experience in gaming law.


****WHO ARE WE?
   

  

 At the core of LeoVegas Group, is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1400 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 11 offices world-wide** 
 .**
**Benefits**
* Life-Occupational injuries & sickness insurance
* Possibility to enrol in an attractive private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 3,000 SEK wellness contribution p/a
* 30 annual vacation days
* 1,500 SEK tech allowance
* Occupational Pension - Details on request
* Benify - A benefits portal with lots of attractive discounts
* Parental pay after 6+ months employment
* Plenty of great company events
* Mobile phone & laptop of your choice
* If you are not based in the job location we will also provide you with a relocation package including flights and accommodation support
* Flexible hybrid working model


**JOIN US!**
 In our pride, we like to empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait around for things to happen, we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 If you think you would be a good fit for the Leo pride - give us a roar!
   

  

 \*\*As our company working language is English we’d like to see your CV in English please\*\*

title: Transaction Services Manager
description:
**Line of Service**
 Advisory
   

  


**Industry/Sector**
 Not Applicable
   

  


**Specialism**
 Deals
   

  


**Management Level**
 Senior Manager
   

  


**Job Description & Summary**
 Transaction Services (FDD) in Stockholm, Sweden, is looking for inbound Managers or Senior Managers to join an expanding team of currently about 50 FDD professionals.
   

  

 In a strong transaction market, we offer excellent career paths for the right candidates. We work primarily with the largest Nordic and global Private Equity companies and large industrial companies both in Sweden and globally. Experience in and an aptitude for working with Private Equity clients is highly valued, as they form a substantial part of our client base.
   

 You will be part of an ambitious team focused on financial due diligence which forms part of the larger unit PwC Deals. We work closely together with other Deals business units and offer our clients and integrated product offering.
   

  

 Preferred skills
   

  

 You are expected to be a driven problem solver with a strong business interest, eager to take on new challenges. We believe it is important that you want to and can establish trustworthy contacts. You are easy to collaborate with, enthusiastic and positive.
   

  

 Other qualities we value are initiative, communicative, strong analytical ability, creativity and business thinking.
   

  

 ● Bachelor ́s (requirement) or Master ́s (meriting) degree in Business, Finance, Economics or
   

 engineering
   

 ● 5-8 years of relevant FDD experience
   

 ● An interest, experience and aptitude to work with Private Equity clients is highly desirable
   

 ● Excellent verbal communication and team working skills
   

 ● Strong analytical and critical thinking, ability to understand and navigate in complexity and
   

 problem-solving skills.
   

 ● Advanced level of English (Swedish is meriting, but no requirement)
   

  

 To thrive with us, you work efficiently, are an explicit team player and are happy to share your
   

 experience and knowledge. You can easily communicate and take on new information and you are motivated by keeping up to date with technical developments.
   

  

 About Transaction Services (FDD)
   

 A career in our Transaction Services (FDD), will provide you the opportunity to work with financial due diligence and other transaction services especially in connection with acquisitions and divestments for our Private Equity and Corporate clients. Our analysis focuses on understanding and analysing the development of the most important value drivers in the target company, establishing the true underlying historical results, cash flows and evaluating a company's ability to reach its forecast - all for the purpose of presenting relevant financial data and insights into a M&A transaction.
   

  

 As part of PwC’s Transaction Services’ team, your responsibilities will include, but might not be limited to, the following:
   

  

 ● Provide both corporate and financial buyers with peace of mind by analysing and validating
   

 financial, commercial, operational and strategic assumptions being made.
   

 ● Provide solutions (through deal documents or deal structure) to identified issues; take into
   

 consideration client and target attributes.
   

 ● Review and analysis of historical trading, cash flow and balance sheets.
   

 ● Review of the adequacy of working capital facilities, including consideration of financing limits,
   

 terms and covenants.
   

 ● Demonstrate a comprehensive understanding of current accounting standards that could impact
   

 the transaction (e.g., IFRS, carve-outs) in order to develop thorough assessments of issues
   

 identified through research, analysis and consultation with technical experts.
   

 ● Demonstrate an ability to effectively assess/analyse client valuation models and provide
   

 meaningful feedback that impacts transaction pricing and/or purchase/sale agreement.
   

 ● Interpretation and analysis of information memoranda, business plans, publicly available
   

 information on the target business.
   

 ● Review of sale and purchase agreement and correlating findings from the due diligence process
   

 therein.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!
   

  

 #exp\_econ

title: Head Of Indirect Procurement
description:
**ABOUT US** 




  





 The Absolut Group (TAG) holds global responsibility for the production, packaging development, innovation and strategic marketing of an extensive range of premium spirits brands. They include the iconic Absolut Vodka, Beefeater, the world’s most awarded gin, Malibu, the leading flavored rum and Kahlua, the number one coffee liqueur, along with a selection of agave spirits, including Altos tequila and craft gins such as Monkey 47. Headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, The Absolut Group is part of Pernod Ricard, a worldwide leader in the spirits and wine industry.
 



  





**ABOUT THE ROLE** 




  





 Following an internal promotion, we are currently looking for our next Head of Indirect Procurement to join us at The Absolut Group and be part of our Pernod Ricard global procurement organization!
 



 In this exciting role you will execute the global procurement strategy for Marketing Services and Business Services categories, boosting procurement maturing across the company, as well as ensuring that the business has access to indirect procurement resources optimally deployed. You will be the key interface between business functions and procurement teams located in various parts of the world.
 



  





 You will be responsible for working across the whole TAG brands portfolio and your focus will span between strategical and operational.
 



  





**Strategy** 



* **Develop and implement procurement strategies** 
 to maximize value in Indirect categories – A&P and Business Services.
 **Be responsible for the strategic direction and management of local procurement activities** 
 incorporating the overall sourcing process and sustainable procurement of associated goods and services.
* **Work with the procurement community** 
 to align indirect procurement strategies with overall company goals and initiatives, animate ecosystem stakeholders and impulse supplier relationships management.
 **Translate diversity and the S&R Global commitments into procurement category objectives** 
 and requirements.
* **Be an active leader** 
 in the procurement transformation program: drive transformation workstream and business alignment, lead implementation of best practices, procurement tools and processes, and procurement maturity in general.
* **Manage and develop further a team of 5 skilled individuals** 
 , fostering dynamic career trajectories and a culture of excellence.



  





**Operational** 



* **Lead procurement operations** 
 for several countries such as Sweden, UK, Mexico, Germany, US, India and China, for a total spend of ≈53M € across Business Service, Content and POS
* **Ensure value maximization** 
 for Indirect procurement along 3 lenses: Buy Better (leverage Pernod Ricard's scale & professionalize procurement practices), Spend Better (harmonize policies, processes and manage demand tightly), Track Better (spend performance, compliance, sustainability and diversity)
* **Collaborate with local/business teams** 
 to understand their indirect spending needs and align procurement strategies accordingly: prioritize initiatives to maximize benefits & monitor category budgets to drive cost optimization
* **Governance:** 
 ensure compliance with procurement policies and procedures against legislation and mitigation of risks
* **Manage** 
 and optimize the procurement process for indirect categories



 For localized spend categories: implement category sourcing strategies (business needs and supplier panel definition), lead commercial execution (negotiation, contractual and legals terms, regulatory compliance) and monitor supplier long-term.
 



 For Co-ordinated spend categories: co-develop category strategies in close link with Global Procurement.
 



 For Global spend categories: support Global Procurement on the discovery, market review process and the contract implementation.
 



  





**ABOUT YOU** 




  





 In this role we see you as a passionate procurement professional, with a creative, forward-thinking and driven approach that create vision and inspiring strategies. You are a strong relationship builder; you work collaboratively with others and through others creating alignment by leveraging a diversity of profiles and competences. You thrive in complex and changing environments by remaining focus and bringing clarity and efficiency.
 


* +10-years’ international experience within procurement
* Diverse and broad profile, with Marketing procurement experience, primarily Creative Content, Design and Content Production
* Experience/deep knowledge of Marketing
* Comfortable with working both hands-on as well as strategically



  





**OUR OFFER** 




 At The Absolut Group, we are the thinking and doing of all our brilliant people. Be audacious and go after your dreams right from the start – and you will thrive in a passionate and progressive environment where we collaborate across borders. Be committed to a sustainable supply chain, a safe, inclusive workplace, and a responsible consumer culture, and we can achieve real change together.
 



 With our spirit of belonging, we create a culture of what we call convivialité. It’s the magic of human connections that makes things happen. You are welcome to The Absolut Group for who you are.
