title: Sales Director in DataOps (Sweden)
description:
Elisa Polystar stands on top of the shoulders of Finnish operator Elisa, the leader in automation of networks. Our vision is to make self-driving networks happen for our customers, communication service providers.


We are a team of dedicated software developers, big data engineers, data scientists, telco engineers, sales professionals, and supporting the core roles are marketing, finance, HR and other business professionals.


We believe in transparency and Nordic work culture – make a significant contribution whilst having a healthy work-life balance.


  
### **Sales Director in DataOps (Sweden) – EMEA**


**DataOps. Software. Automation. Cloud native. For Mobile Network Operators (MNO’s)**. By an international company based in Europe. Have background in this cutting edge segment? We want to hear how you’d excel in a regional sales role!

*Elisa Polystar is a growth company owned by €2BN revenue (20% profit) Elisa Group, and Elisa Polystar is growing quick. The core business is on assuring network quality, to automate network operations and make autonomous, software-driven networks happen. Our mission is to contribute to a sustainable future through digitalization.*

**We now look forward to hiring an ambitious, self-driven Business Region Director to lead European Sales in DataOps.**


We work with MNOs that Elisa Polystar can help in organizing and analyzing data, automate the running of Network Operating Centres and monitor the networks.

**The potential that we can bring for our clients is massive**. The decisions to automate are not simple to make for an organization, but requires the company carefully assess the setup, investment and improved quality and decreasing running costs. How Networks plan to manage their data management future is a key area Elisa Polystar can support. We need you to take a full charge of this engagement end-to-end with key stakeholders of the clients from VP level upwards.

* The job’s not easy but when you have a background in DataOps software related sales to MNOs with success – it’s an exciting challenge.
* With relevant networks, personal mindset to aim high and get the results, good understanding of the complexity of the solutions and the road to decision-making, you can blow up the targets!
* The solutions we provide and the story we possess starting from the Telco-to-Telco story makes the case ideal for you to join in! For more information on the solutions, see: https://elisapolystar.com/products/
* Being an agile company and part of publicly listed Elisa Group translates to an environment where you can make your mark but also get the support when you need it.

**Interested? Let’s go – click the button.**


We’d love you to join in helping the 100+ Telecom companies we already provide solutions for. We are 400+ people in 25 countries on 5 continents. You can work anywhere in Europe where Elisa Group has an office (FI, SWE, PL, SVK, ROM, GER, UK, SPA).


The recruitment process is simple, quick chat with our recruiter, interview with the hiring manager, with one or two discussions to follow.


The traditional description of the ideal background is below. We look hearing from you!

**Background:**

* 7+ years of relevant direct sales or channel sales experience in Telco and / or major Enterprises addressing DataOps and related technology. Experience of network-related sales an advantage.
* Extensive consultative experience in developing business through the cloud and data journeys of major customers. Exposure to the following is necessary: sector knowledge of big data and associated storage environments (lakehouse, data warehousing, cloud etc.), ETL, BI, and AI/ML concepts and techniques.
* Extensive experience leading high-value RFX processes and negotiating large contracts.
* Experience leading virtual teams in customer engagements and leveraging different strands of the business to support customer processes.
* Ability to travel frequently.
* Fluent written and spoken English plus another European language preferred.
  


For privacy policy in recruitments, check: www.elisapolystar.com/privacy-policy/

title: Senior Systems Administrator
description:
### **Job Description:**

**Remote Work - Sweden-based resource**


**Position:** Senior Systems Administrator


**Experience:**


* Proven experience: Typically, senior sysadmins have 35 years of work experience in system administration.
* Familiarity with UNIX, Storage, and VMWare
* Knowledge of patching tools for server environments
* Understanding of Data Protection and Storage
* Operating systems: Strong knowledge of operating systems (e.g., Windows Server, Redhat Linux/Oracle).
* Network protocols: Understanding of network protocols.
* Hardware components: Familiarity with hardware components.
* Virtualization technologies: Experience with virtualization (e.g., VMWare/ESX).
* Cloud environments: Knowledge of cloud platforms.
* Containerization: Understanding of containerization technologies.


**Requirements:**


* Must be an EC (Eligible Citizen) or resident of the country
* Bachelor's degree: A degree in Computer Science or a related field is beneficial.
* Minimum 3 years of Data Center Support Experience
* Supervisory skills: Since senior admins often lead teams, demonstrating the ability to provide guidance to junior specialists is essential.
* Problem-solving skills: Excellent troubleshooting abilities.
* Communication skills: Effective communication with team members and users.
* Project management: Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects.


**Certifications (Any of the following)**:


* Microsoft Certified Systems Engineer (MCSE
* CompTIA A+ Certification
* VMWare Certified Professional (VCP
* Red Hat Certified System Administrator (RHCSA)
* Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA)
* Citrix Certified Administrator (CCA)
* Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert (MCSE: Server Infrastructure)
* Oracle Database Administrator Certified Professional (OCP)

##### **Required Skills:**

Data Center System Administration Citrix Virtualization Oracle Database Protection VMware Windows Server Unix Components Operating Systems Storage Infrastructure Linux Oracle Troubleshooting Computer Science Windows Administration Project Management Communication Science Management

title: Senior Sales Engineer
description:
**Build your future with Sovos.**



If you're seeking a career where innovation meets impact, you've come to the right place. As a global leader, Sovos is transforming tax compliance from a business requirement to a force for growth while revolutionising how businesses navigate the ever-changing regulatory landscape.



At Sovos, we're dedicated to more than just solving compliance challenges – we're committed to making a positive and lasting difference in everything we do. Our teams operate on the modern edge of digital technology, working not only to solve complex business challenges but also to enrich our personal, professional, and local communities.



Our purpose-built systems provide the tools you need to thrive in a world where governments demand increased visibility, faster reporting and greater control over business processes. Excited about the possibilities? So are we!



Don’t worry if you don't check all the boxes – apply anyway! We're focused on hiring the right people, not just the "right" resume. It's not about what you've done elsewhere; it's all about what you're capable of doing here.

  


**The Work You'll Do:**



The Senior Sales Engineer will support and guide Sales Engineers while working with the Direct Sales and Alliance teams to provide subject matter expertise for our tax information reporting solutions.


*More specifically you will:*

  

* Provide superior domain expertise around Tax Information Reporting
* Challenge bad sales processes and behaviours and establish and support best practices
* Maintain expert level understanding of functionality and technical architecture of our products
* Assist in the client discovery process to help uncover unforeseen challenges and ensure the proper offering is being proposed
* Guide the strategic efforts to conduct sales and solutions presentations for clients of all sizes
* Develop and lead training sessions both within and outside the Sales Engineer department
* Assist Sales Engineers in designing and delivering customised solution demonstrations using Sovos SaaS solutions and services
* Service as a subject matter expert surrounding the creation of RFP and RFI responses for prospective new clients
* Work closely with the on-boarding team ensuring a seamless handoff from sales to on-boarding for new clients
* Maintain and continually improve demonstration capabilities, conducting internal Sales department training, demo system props and proposal content
* Act with integrity and demonstrate ethical behaviour in all matters with all stakeholders
* Take full responsibility for ensuring internal and external customer satisfaction
* Demonstrate initiative, drive and determination to achieve results, success and growth
* Maintain a high level of energy, enthusiasm, engagement and commitment to action
* Demonstrate a high degree of self-awareness and commitment to personal development and learning
  

**What We Need From You**


* Minimum 4+ years’ of sales related experience
* Customer facing experience, required
* Ability to be strategic towards business outcomes as well as manage and handle day-to-day details and deadlines
* Strong team orientation with a history of working collaboratively in a fast paced environment
* Ability to manage multiple priorities (at times conflicting), remain focused under pressure and work extended hours as required
* Thorough knowledge of MS Office software including Excel, Word, & Power Point
* Well-developed business ethics and the ability to maintain a high level of discretion
* Self-motivated and strong drive to succeed
* Moderate travel required for client meetings, trade shows, and special projects including some international travel
* Ability to pass a background, drug and credit check
* Essential Job Functions:
	+ Interact effectively with teammates, colleagues and customers
	+ Comprehend and communicate complex concepts
	+ Concentrate, analyse and resolve complex problems
	+ Utilise technology (e.g. phone systems, computer hardware and software applications) to fulfil work requirements

**What Does Sovos Offer You?**


The tools to enhance your life - because we want you to enjoy your life outside of work and inside!


* An opportunity to work with a global team
* Bi-Weekly Meeting Free Days!
* Mentoring Programs
* Globally recognised Training and Development programs
* Benefits

*Sovos is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an environment that celebrates diversity and where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and employees. We do not discriminate against race, color, religions, national origin, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic provided by law. At Sovos, all employees are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work.*


**Company Background**


Sovos is a global provider of tax, compliance and trust solutions and services that enable businesses to navigate an increasingly regulated world with true confidence. Purpose-built for always-on compliance capabilities, our scalable IT-driven solutions meet the demands of an evolving and complex global regulatory landscape. Sovos’ cloud-based software platform provides an unparalleled level of integration with business applications and government compliance processes.


More than 100,000 customers in 100+ countries – including half the Fortune 500 – trust Sovos for their compliance needs. Sovos annually processes more than three billion transactions across 19,000 global tax jurisdictions. Bolstered by a robust partner program more than 400 strong, Sovos brings to bear an unrivaled global network for companies across industries and geographies. Founded in 1979, Sovos has operations across the Americas and Europe, and is owned by Hg and TA Associates. For more information visit http://www.sovos.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.
company_description: Sovos is a global SaaS company capable of meeting your regulatory compliance needs anywhere you do business.

title: Identity and Access Management Specialist
description:
*Our employees are our most valuable resource; for them to do their best at work, they need the best tools and services in place. Therefore, we are looking for an Identity and Access Management Specialist for our Workplace and Collaboration team!*

*You will join an organization which is at the forefront of using Microsoft’s platforms and services as we are working with cutting-edge technology and are happy that you want to be part of it. You will be of great importance in our constantly growing organization.*

**About the job**
=================


In this role, you are the interface between the business and the technical solution and implementation, and you will work very closely with our Information security department. You’ll be highly involved in projects for both improvements and implementation of new features. If there is an incident, you will be part of the contact to solve it as smoothly as possible.

**You will be working with Identity and Access Management as well as Active Directory, e.g.:**

* Ensures that system access is maintained per company policy
* Supports all access management control activities across all infrastructure systems
* Ensures access to systems is provisioned with the concept of least privilege
* Evaluate existing access to ensure access levels remain commensurate with job responsibilities
* Responsible for identity and access management services to analyze and develop continued improvements of provision processes, operations and integrations
* Attribute mapping throughout our systems
* Scripting and Automation
* Documentation of services


Our teams operate with integrity and respect for one another fueled by an entrepreneurial spirit. We are building a high-performance organization through investing in our people, we offer a great opportunity for personal development with an environment characterized by humbleness and knowledge sharing and to enhance the on-the-job training we have a training budget to ensure personal growth.

**About you**
=============


Most importantly, you are a person who likes to contribute with your knowledge, as well as take part in the team's knowledge, you are a true team player who supports your colleagues, shares information when needed and helps build team spirit.


We appreciate your passion and drive, together with your previous experience working with advanced maintenance. Operation and troubleshooting in Windows environment, especially Active Directory on-prem, Azure Active Directory and of course Identity and Access Management. With us, you will continue and improve your abilities in driving automation and building secure integrations using your advanced scripting skills (furthermost C# and PowerShell) or your knowledge of e.g., cloud-based solutions.


To have fun and be successful in your role here at Verisure, you need to be a curious problem solver with the ability to work productively in a fast-paced environment. You own your area of responsibility, make sure long-term solutions can be used by all user profiles and secure this by communicating with the requester in a clear and good way.

**It would be great if you also have:**

* Strong attention to detail and accuracy
* A relevant degree in System Engineering or other equivalent background
* Basic understanding of network concepts, including DNS, TCP/IP, and other fundamental networking protocols

**About Verisure**
==================


Verisure is the leading European provider of professionally monitored security systems with 24/7 response services. We protect more than 5 million families and small businesses across 17 countries in Europe and Latin America. And our mission is to provide our customers peace of mind by protecting what matters most to them.


With over 35 years of insight, experience, and innovation, Verisure is known for category-creating marketing, sales excellence, innovative products and services, and customer-centricity.


Thanks to a strong focus on high quality, our customers are amongst the most satisfied and loyal in our industry. We have some of the strongest growth and retention rates globally in consumer-facing services which demonstrates our exceptional service levels and strong value proposition to our customers.

**My team and I eagerly await your application! Join us on this thrilling journey towards a safer, smarter world. Apply today!**


If you have questions regarding this position, please reach out to our Group TA Specialist, Robert Jonasson at robert.jonasson@verisure.com


At Verisure, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace, recognising that diversity of thought and background only makes our teams stronger and more innovative. We reject all forms of discrimination and bias, and we believe in access to opportunities for everyone, regardless of gender, age, disability status, race, sexual orientation, or any other status.

**Verisure - 35 years of delivering peace of mind.**
====================================================
company_description: Verisure, a fast growing company full of career opportunities. Verisure Belgium is part of a global organisation active in 14 countries.

title: Cyber Security Advisor
description:
**Job Description**
 The Cyber Security Advisory Team at H&M Group plays a crucial role in ensuring the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of our information and technology assets. We provide tactical and operational cyber security advice to our business stakeholders.
   

  

 As a team, we believe in a non-hierarchical culture of collaboration, transparency, and trust. In this role, you will be developing and maintaining a strong relationship with the business stakeholders and ensuring that their cyber security needs are met.
   

  

 What you will do as a Cyber Security Advisor:
   

  

* Conduct security assessment of in-house developed and/or by third-party provided solutions in order to ensure that they are in compliance with H&M's security standards
* Security maturity and risk assessment for internal and external partners
* Providing targeted security trainings
* Understand the business needs and help them achieve their goals while meeting Cyber Security needs as well


**Qualifications**
**What you need to succeed:**
* Experience working with Cyber Security in an Enterprise environment
* Strong understanding of cyber security concepts, ability to give technical advice to business in security matters
* Proven experience of cyber security or privacy frameworks, standards, and regulations, such as ISO 27001, NIST, CIS, and GDPR
* Having a business mindset – understanding the needs and way of working in business and being a partner for them to reach their goals
* Experience with highly effective and strong communication with business stakeholders in all levels of an organization
* Familiarity with AI, Generative AI and ML
* Experience of the retail industry is a merit
* Fluent level of oral and written English
* A positive spirit and attitude


 Curiosity and learning mindset are also crucial to be successful in this role since it requires to work with new technologies before they’re launched to bigger audiences. Showcasing how you stay on top of new knowledge is very important for us.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 This is a fulltime permanent position. The role is based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden and we have a hybrid work structure.
   

  

 Apply by sending in your
 **CV in English** 
 as soon as possible. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through career page.
   

  

**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity**
 At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.
   

  

**Company Description**
 H&M Group is a family of brands; H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET and Afound. At H&M Group, our people are the driving force behind our commitment to creating meaningful growth and more sustainable lifestyles. Help us re-imagine fashion and together we will re-shape our industry. Learn more about H&M Group here.

title: Field Service IT Support Engineer-SOLNA , Sweden-Permanent hiring
description:
**Role: Field Service IT Support Engineer.** 




**Location: Solna, Sweden.** 




**Job Type: Permanent.** 




  





**Job Description:** 




**Field Service IT Support:** 




 Workstation Services (e.g., Desktop, Monitors, Printers and laptop).
 


* Breakfix
* Desktop/Laptop Hardware related troubleshooting - Create, test and develop current Workstation images.
* Prepare and configured new laptops/workstations specifications as assigned.
* End User Computing (EUC) Device Refresh as part of BAU ( any bulk refresh will be treated as separate project activity)
* Works closely with vendors and managed services to maintain systems and services, manage change, and deploy new systems and services
* Provide onsite PC repair, virus- and spyware-remediation, maintenance/rejuvenation, data-recovery, networking and upgrades.
* Windows upgradations through SCCM agent.
* OS and application installation: Windows migrations and deployment of customized images using SCCM
* Troubleshoot for Windows and have good working knowledge of Office products; provide printer/fax support
* Knowledge of server and network communications equipment, protocols (i.e. DNS and TCPIP), transmission media, security and network management practices
* Analyzed and diagnosed DNS/DHCP/VPN and other networking issues
* End user issues related to network, IP config, windows troubleshooting
* Actively worked with hardware and software vendors to resolve client issues in a timely manner
* Active Directory, folder access and Group Policy administration, hardware configuration. User Support for VPN, MS Office, applications.
* Installation of printers, Configuring conference room facilities
* IP Phone installation, troubleshooting
* O365 configuration, troubleshooting
* Other aspects related to End user computing
* Deskside Support
* Spares management
* Installs, moves, adds, changes of hardware and software packages (IMAC);Hardware life cycle management
* Security compliance
* Populate Knowledge Management system with resolutions and workarounds
* Act as an escalation resource to the Help Desk, Site Administrators and Network Operations Center to assist with issues affecting endpoints
* Enterprise Mobility Management administration - enrollment and management of mobile devices. Adept knowledge on Airwatch – intelligent hub/MDM/ intune / azure
* Fault diagnosis / troubleshooting
* Maintain the Service Now queue of an average of 5-20 tickets per day, resolved Level 1-2 support issues
* Ensure swift ticket resolution and escalate issues to Level 3 technician as necessary
* Adept knowledge on Software Center(SWC) and ServiceNow
* Knowledge of Okta and its usage.

title: Cyber Security Architect
description:
**Job Description**
 Do you have a curious and analytical mindset and get inspired from being part of building a new world class cyber security organization? Then H&M Group can offer you a position that matches your personality! We are looking for Cyber Security Architect to join our organization based in Stockholm.
   

  

**Responsibilities** 
 :
   

  

* Contextualize corporate strategic vision, conducting analysis, identifying opportunities, and defining strategic activities in the Cyber Security domain.
* Analyze, design, develop, and maintain roadmaps and implementation plans to enable future-state security capabilities, ensuring organizational resilience, stability, and operational excellence.
* Drive continuous improvement and simplification to enhance end-to-end business value, collaborating across the organization to lower the total cost of ownership.
* Develop control mechanisms to manage Cyber risks in alignment with business risk appetite.


**Architecture Enablement** 
 :
   

  

* Develop conceptual and logical architecture designs, creating artifacts such as security principles, guardrails, capability models, and future state blueprints.
* Facilitate the delivery of targeted business outcomes, including drafting and proposing Architecture Decision Records, anchoring and ratifying Architecture Decisions, and monitoring their adoption and effectiveness.
* Maintain a registry of security solutions relevant to the domain, ensuring security capability maturity and managing the lifecycle of Architecture Decision Records.


**Change Enablement** 
 :
   

  

* Identify interdependencies and employ holistic thinking to design and implement solutions, considering cross-team perspectives.
* Act as a facilitator for complex technical topics, collaborating across functions to ensure comprehensive consultation.
* Communicate security best practices to embed security into platforms and products, sharing knowledge with the engineering and delivery community.


**Qualifications**
 What you need to succeed:
   

  

* Mastery of multiple security areas with deeper expertise in one or more of the following: Device security, Application security, Data security, Cloud security, Network security, Secure development, and IAM.
* Demonstrated skills and experience in information security within an international and diverse context.
* Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively within a non-hierarchical culture of


**Additional Information**
**Working with tech at H&M Group**
 Shaping the future of fashion with people, data, and tech. The fashion and retail industries are going through a transformation, driven by customers' technology and sustainability expectations. At H&M Group, we want to shape the future of fashion and lifestyle by harnessing the power of smart tech and data. With our 74-year history of innovation, we understand the need to collaborate and co-create with engineers and tech specialists around the world to achieve our vision.
   

  

**What we offer!**
 You are joining a unique value-driven culture, a large tech network and community where you can be yourself. Besides the obvious perks such as staff discount card, flexible work life, learning communities, wellness benefits, parental benefits etc. There are endless opportunities to experiment and grow in any direction that you want, and when you grow, we grow. Being a major player gives us countless opportunities to make a real impact and shape the future.
   

  

 This is a full-time position with placement in Stockholm

title: System Engineer // Cybersecurity // Stockholm (Hybrid) // Up to SEK 600.000p.a.
description:

 Join our specialized cybersecurity company that helps organizations secure identities and data in a user-friendly way. We pride ourselves on creating easy-to-use solutions that keep your company safe.
 



  





 As a System Engineer, you will assist the IT department with all aspects of technology, supporting office and regional priorities as we continuously strive to improve our IT systems and services. Your role involves troubleshooting within the company's server environment, both on-premises and cloud systems, and networks. You will maintain an inventory of hardware and software, ensure systems are up-to-date, and provide technical support to employees on various IT-related issues.

* **Manage Domain Controllers**

**Our Offer** 



* **Team Spirit**

 Apply now and be a part of our forward-thinking, innovative team!

title: IAM Solution Architect
description:
**Company Description**
**Job Description**
 As an
 **IAM Architect** 
 , you'll have the position in designing and implementing identity and access management solutions within the organization. Your collaborative efforts with diverse teams will ensure that business requirements and regulatory standards are met through effective IAM strategies. Beyond just designing solutions, your role extends to assessing the current infrastructure, crafting IAM frameworks, and seamlessly integrating solutions across systems. Your expertise will be crucial in selecting the right technologies, establishing standards, and ensuring compliance with regulations. Ultimately, your contributions will be pivotal in fortifying data security and facilitating the organization's business objectives through robust IAM practices.
   

  

**Responsibilities** 
 :
   

  

* Design and implement IAM solutions leveraging HRM tools, IDM tools, and IGA tools, ensuring seamless integration with business systems.
* Architect global directory solutions, including Active Directory, Entra ID, and federation solutions such as Entra ID, ADFS, and PKI.
* Optimize and manage PAM solutions to enhance security and access control.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and develop IAM strategies aligned with business objectives.
* Provide technical guidance and mentorship to cross-functional teams on IAM best practices and technologies.
* Stay abreast of industry trends and emerging technologies in IAM, continuously enhancing your knowledge and expertise.


**Qualifications**
**Mandatory requirements** 
 :
   

  

* Proven experience in architecting and implementing IAM solutions, with a strong understanding of HRM tools, IDM tools, and IGA tools.
* Expertise in global directory solutions, including Active Directory, Entra ID, federation solutions, and PKI.
* Familiarity with PAM solutions and best practices for access management and security.


**Optional requirements** 
 :
   

  

* Experience with Saviynt as an IGA tool and BeyondTrust PasswordSafe knowledge.
* Certifications in IT frameworks and IAM technologies, such as CISSP, CISM, or vendor-specific certifications.
* Knowledge of security controls and compliance standards, including ISO standards.


**Additional Information**
**Working with tech at H&M Group**
 Shaping the future of fashion with people, data, and tech. The fashion and retail industries are going through a transformation, driven by customers' technology and sustainability expectations. At H&M Group, we want to shape the future of fashion and lifestyle by harnessing the power of smart tech and data. With our 74-year history of innovation, we understand the need to collaborate and co-create with engineers and tech specialists around the world to achieve our vision.

 You are joining a unique value-driven culture, a large tech network and community where you can be yourself. title: Regional Systems Operations Manager
company: Oil and Gas Job Search Ltd
description:
**Join Schneider Electric as our Regional Systems Operations Manager!**
 Are you ready to take the lead in driving our Digital Buildings Systems to unparalleled success in Europe & France? As the Regional Systems Operations Manager, you'll play a pivotal role in elevating our systems organization for Data Centre projects, providing expert support from sales to flawless project execution. Join us in shaping the future of energy management and sustainability!
   

  

**What We Offer You**
* Competitive Rewards: Enjoy a competitive salary, bonus scheme, and a range of enticing benefits including 28 days annual leave, pension scheme, and employee share ownership programme.
* Health & Wellbeing: Access various health and wellbeing support options, gym flex, and a holiday buy & sell programme to suit your lifestyle.
* Career Development: Benefit from our Open Talent Market, offering internal mobility opportunities, access to mentors, and projects globally, along with our comprehensive learning portal.
* Inclusive Environment: Experience our commitment to diversity and inclusion, with opportunities for all and support for those considering themselves living with a disability.
* Perks and Discounts: Enjoy shopping and dining discounts as part of our employee perks package.


**What your mission will look like?**
* Champion the transformation of our Digital Buildings Systems to best in class, from selling to successful execution of systems organization for Data Centre projects in Europe & France.
* Provide invaluable support to our teams and clients, ensuring excellence in environment monitoring systems and driving high performance systems culture.


**Key Responsibilities Will Include**
* Driving bid assessment, customer project performance, and aligned execution approach across the region.
* Acting as a trusted advisor, ensuring consistent customer experience and knowledge transfer across all projects.
* Ensuring the development, implementation, and maintenance of global rules, methodologies, processes, and tools.


**What will help you succeed?**
* Excellent communication and leadership skills to drive high performance and collaboration
* Analytical skills to handle complex matters effectively and experience in builduing management systems
* Professional knowledge of the electrical industry and experience in the Lifescience segment are valued
* Experience in a multicultural team environment and readiness to travel


 Ready to make an impact with us?
   

  

 Join Schneider Electric and be part of a team shaping the future of energy management. Apply now and let us learn about you!
   

  

**Why us?**
 Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive.
   

  

 ₠34bn global revenue
   

  

 128 000+ employees in 100+ countries
   

  

 45% of revenue from IoT
   

  

 5% of revenue devoted for R&D
   

  

 You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled
   

  

 It is the policy of Schneider Electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct. Concerning agencies: Schneider Electric does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.

title: Senior Account Executive
description:
**About AvePoint**
 Securing the Future. AvePoint is a global leader in data management and data governance, and over 21,000 customers worldwide rely on our solutions to modernize the digital workplace across Microsoft, Google, Salesforce and other collaboration environments. AvePoint’s global channel partner program includes over 3,500 managed service providers, value added resellers and systems integrators, with our solutions available in more than 100 cloud marketplaces. To learn more, visit www.avepoint.com.
   

  

 At AvePoint, we are committed to investing in our people: we believe agility, passion and teamwork sets us up to do our best work and fosters a culture where you feel empowered to take initiative, learn from others and craft your career with the intention to unleash the power of you!
   

  

**About The Position**
 Are you looking for a role where you can truly influence and manage your own book of business in a collaborative sales environment? We believe in entrepreneurship and empower you to make decisions that will grow our business. We will provide you with all the resources needed to be a successful high-earning sales executive.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
 The Enterprise Account Executive participates in a team-selling environment and will assume the ownership role for their assigned geographic accounts and territory. The Account Executive will be driving the identification and qualification of opportunities, developing and executing account & opportunity plans leading to the generation of software license, maintenance and services revenues. In addition, the Account Executive will facilitate and maintain successful relationships with customers, which will be measured by their reference ability, customer satisfaction levels and increased revenue levels.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities Will Include**
* Developing new prospects and expanding existing accounts
* Using consultative selling techniques to teach customers about their industry and offer insights and perspectives on IT needs that are fulfilled by our solutions
* Using competitive analysis to educate customers on the value of our solutions
* Continuously pursuing quota goals by working directly with the customer during negotiations
* Working with a virtual account team to deploy the customer engagement lifecycle, that include; Marketing for lead generation, Business Development Representatives for lead qualification, Pre-sales Engineers for technical support, and Customer Success Managers for renewals after the initial sale
* Attending and participating in customer team meetings and communicating regularly with professional services and engineering staff to ensure customer satisfaction
* Leveraging existing industry partnerships to grow AvePoint’s presence in your region and establishing proactive relationships with influential people, both with the customer and other third parties
* Handling post-sales support issues for customers, e.g. escalation of support calls, identifying additional training needs, etc


**What You Will Bring To Our Team**
 We look for people who value agility, passion and teamwork; those who can bring fresh ideas to the table and want the opportunity to learn, grow, and expand their careers. Bring your aptitude and build upon what you do best for our customers, partners, team, and you.
   

  

 As an Enterprise Account Executive, you are tasked with bringing in new business with our largest customers. You need to be highly competitive and a strategic thinker with the ability to spot new opportunities that generate revenue. You are someone who has a strong sense of urgency and accountability to execute the full sales cycle, and you take pride in seeing your hard work and strategy development pay off when you see the final results.
   

  

 Other qualities you’ll need to be a fit for this role include:
   

  

* University degree or equivalent experience
* 5+ years of enterprise software sales experience
* Exposure to virtual account team selling environment
* Executive level relationship selling experience
* General familiarity with selling methodologies and processes
* strong communication skills, must be fluent in English & Swedish
* Accountability
* Sense of urgency
* Collaborative
* Highly competitive
* Strong work ethic


 AvePoint is proud to employ talent from many different backgrounds, experiences, and identities. We believe that diversity and inclusion drives our success and is at the core of how we hire, communicate, and collaborate to deliver value and excellence. We are committed to fostering an environment where people can bring their whole selves to work and feel a sense of belonging, and we continue to work toward creating a workforce that represents the diversity of our customers and communities.

title: Principal Solution Architect (Nordics & Benelux)
description:
**Description**
 What makes us Qlik?
   

  

 A Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ Leader for 13 years, Qlik transforms complex data landscapes into actionable insights, driving strategic business outcomes.
   

  

 Serving over 40,000 global customers, our portfolio leverages pervasive data quality and advanced AI/ML capabilities that lead to faster and better decisions.
   

  

 We excel in integration and governance solutions that work with diverse data sources. Our real-time analytics uncover hidden patterns, empowering teams to address complex challenges and seize new opportunities.
   

  

 The Solution Architect Role
   

  

 Are you ready for a role with diverse responsibilities, constant excitement, and the opportunity to work closely with our largest regional customers and partners?
   

  

 As a Solutions Architect at Qlik, you'll be a key player in our Sales Organization, collaborating with various teams and staying at the forefront of the latest developments in the Data, Analytics, and AI market. If you thrive in a dynamic, agile work environment and are motivated by technical challenges, this position might be the perfect fit for you!
   

  

 What makes this role interesting?
   

  

* Take complete ownership of technical relationships and the sales cycle by effectively showcasing the technical and business value of Qlik's next-generation data analytics, ML/AI, and data integration platform to customers, partners, and internal teams.
* Engage with key customer stakeholders through exceptional solution presentations and custom demonstrations. Position proposed solutions to technical, end-users, operations, and senior management staff.
* Stay informed about Qlik's latest product developments and competitors in the Data, Analytics & AI market. Work closely with Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, Product, R&D, and Consulting teams.


**Here's How You'll Be Making An Impact**
* Technical Ownership: Demonstrate end-to-end ownership of technical relationships and the technical sales cycle.
* Sales Qualification: Contribute to the technical qualification and closure of sales opportunities, predominantly involving Qlik's Data Integration, Automated Machine Learning, and AI platform. Collaborate


 with colleagues to address customers' data integration and governance requirements utilizing Qlik Talend Data Integration solutions.
   

  

* Presales Activities: Engage in initiatives to boost regional revenue, delivering outstanding solution presentations and tailored demonstrations.
* Solution Positioning: Present potential solutions to stakeholders within the prospect's or Qlik partner's organization.
* Proof-of-Concept Execution: Execute Proof-of-Concepts successfully to demonstrate the value of Qlik's solutions to potential customers.
* Regional Business Development: Support regional business development activities, such as marketing events, trade shows, and partner events.
* Internal Enablement and Content Creation: Create valuable content for our team and across teams. This could include writing white papers, community articles, customer success stories, etc.


**We're Looking For a Teammate With The Following**
* 3-5 years of experience in a Presales, Consulting, or similar technical capacity
* Excellent communication skills to convince both business and technical audiences
* Highly driven with strong interpersonal skills. Proven track record of developing relationships at technical, commercial, and executive levels throughout large enterprises
* Experience in BI, data visualization, and analytics. Proficient with cloud solutions like SaaS, PaaS, and iPaaS.
* Strong knowledge of areas like Data Integration (ETL/ELT), Data Warehousing, APIs, Data Quality, and Data Governance
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple complex opportunities
* Previous experience with Data Integration products is a strong advantage.
* Proficient knowledge of web development technologies such as JavaScript, HTML5, .NET, and Python is beneficial.
* A solid understanding of Machine Learning tools and Generative AI concepts is advantageous.
* Expertise in Cloud technologies, including certifications for specific hyperscalers (AWS, Azure, GCP), is a plus.
* This position requires willingness and ability to travel.
* Fluent in one of the Nordic languages and English


 The location for this role is:
   

  

 The role is located in Stockholm.
   

  

**More About Qlik And Who We Are**
 Find out more about life at Qlik on social media: Instagram, LinkedIn, YouTube, and X/Twitter. To see all other opportunities to join us and learn about our values, check out our Careers Pag e.
   

  

 What else do we offer?
   

  

* Genuine career progression pathways and mentoring programs
* Culture of innovation, technology, collaboration, and openness
* Flexible, diverse, and international work environment


 Giving back is a massive part of our culture. Alongside an extra "change the world" day plus another for personal development, we also highly encourage participation in our Corporate Responsibility Employee Programs.
   

  

 If you need assistance applying for a role due to a disability, please email your request to accessibility @ qlik.com. Any information you provide will be treated according to Qlik's Recruitment Privacy Notice. Qlik may only respond to emails related to accommodation requests.
   

  

 Qlik is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Qlik via email, the Internet, or in any form and method without a valid written search agreement for this position will be deemed the sole property of Qlik. No fee will be paid if Qlik hires the candidate due to the referral or through other means.

title: Regional Systems Operations Manager
description:
**Join Schneider Electric as our Regional Systems Operations Manager!**
 Are you ready to take the lead in driving our Digital Buildings Systems to unparalleled success in Europe & France? As the Regional Systems Operations Manager, you'll play a pivotal role in elevating our systems organization for Data Centre projects, providing expert support from sales to flawless project execution. Join us in shaping the future of energy management and sustainability!
   

  

**What we offer you:**
* Competitive Rewards: Enjoy a competitive salary, bonus scheme, and a range of enticing benefits including 28 days annual leave, pension scheme, and employee share ownership programme.
* Health & Wellbeing: Access various health and wellbeing support options, gym flex, and a holiday buy & sell programme to suit your lifestyle.
* Career Development: Benefit from our Open Talent Market, offering internal mobility opportunities, access to mentors, and projects globally, along with our comprehensive learning portal.
* Inclusive Environment: Experience our commitment to diversity and inclusion, with opportunities for all and support for those considering themselves living with a disability.
* Perks and Discounts: Enjoy shopping and dining discounts as part of our employee perks package.


**What your mission will look like?**
* Champion the transformation of our Digital Buildings Systems to best in class, from selling to successful execution of systems organization for Data Centre projects in Europe & France.
* Provide invaluable support to our teams and clients, ensuring excellence in environment monitoring systems and driving high performance systems culture.


**Key responsibilities will include:**
* Driving bid assessment, customer project performance, and aligned execution approach across the region.
* Acting as a trusted advisor, ensuring consistent customer experience and knowledge transfer across all projects.
* Ensuring the development, implementation, and maintenance of global rules, methodologies, processes, and tools.


**What will help you succeed?**
* Excellent communication and leadership skills to drive high performance and collaboration
* Analytical skills to handle complex matters effectively and experience in builduing management systems
* Professional knowledge of the electrical industry and experience in the Lifescience segment are valued
* Experience in a multicultural team environment and readiness to travel


 Ready to make an impact with us?
   

  

 Join Schneider Electric and be part of a team shaping the future of energy management. Apply now and let us learn about you!
   

  

**Why us?**
 Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive.
   

  

 €34bn global revenue
   

  

 128 000+ employees in 100+ countries
   

  

 45% of revenue from IoT
   

  

 5% of revenue devoted for R&D
   

  

 You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled
   

  

 It is the policy of Schneider Electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct. Concerning agencies: Schneider Electric does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.

title: Datacenter Lead Nordic
description:
*At Siemens we are always looking for world-class leaders who inspires others with a bold mindset and brings out the best in our people. By combining the real and the digital world- we build a better future for cities, societies, and industries to change the lives of billions of people for the better.*
 We believe that technology provides the solutions for the greatest challenges of our time. Technology is made by
 **people** 
 – it's up to us to lead the change and create an impact. This is how we give innovation a meaning and this is
 **#TechnologyWithPurpose.**
**Are you ready for an opportunity of a lifetime?**
 Join us to make a significant impact and help shape the future of sustainable infrastructure in the Data Center industry. As
 **Datacenter Lead Nordic** 
 at Siemens Smart Infrastructure (SI), you will spearhead the development and implementation of a sustainable cross-business Data Center Vertical Market Strategy. Your mission is to drive profit, growth, and satisfaction for customers and employees in this vertical. This role can be based in any of the Nordic countries.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Deep understanding of the Data Centre vertical landscape, including customers and competitors.
* Strong network at senior levels within the industry.
* Customer-centric mindset with a proven track record of building strategies that drive sustainable growth.
* Adaptive leadership style to engage with teams and stakeholders, fostering a culture of trust and belonging.
* Excellent analytical, strategic thinking, and strong English communication skills.


**Your Success Factors**
* Deep understanding of the Data Centre vertical landscape, including customers and competitors.
* Strong network at senior levels within the industry.
* Customer-centric mindset with a proven track record of building strategies that drive sustainable growth.
* Adaptive leadership style to engage with teams and stakeholders, fostering a culture of trust and belonging.
* Excellent analytical, strategic thinking, and strong English communication skills.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Leadership: experience from leading and developing a business and/or teams, with strong negotiation and influencing skills.
* Experience: 5+ years from Data Center industry. Additional experience from Siemens or similar Building Technologies or Power Distribution portfolios would be an advantage.
* Sales Management experience to ensure and lead the Data Vertical to achieve sustainable financial results
* Project Management experience to lead, manage and oversee complex technical projects.
* Market insight: Over 5 years identifying vertical market opportunities and commercializing solutions.


**We offer**
 Join us for an exciting and dynamic career filled with professional challenges in a supportive environment, as well as career opportunities within an international corporation. Enjoy competitive salary packages, good pension plans, insurance coverage and welfare benefits. You can also experience a diverse array of tasks across our numerous disciplines and business sectors, ensuring a stimulating and varied work experience
 **#TeamSiemens.**
 We offer a dynamic work environment, opportunities for professional growth, and the chance to make a significant impact within the data center industry.
   

  

**Create a better tomorrow with us**
 We are looking forward to receiving your online application latest by 30th of August. We will be evaluating applications continuously, however due to summer vacation, please do not expect any feedback or updates on further process until mid-August at the earliest. For questions about the recruitment process please contact Lene Hoem Angelsen,
   

  

 lene-hoem.angelsen@siemens.com,Talent Acquisition Partner.
   

  

**About Siemens**
 Siemens is a focused technology company, pioneering intelligent solutions that transform the everyday in manufacturing, grids, buildings, and transportation. Our technology addresses real problems that affect the future of humanity:
 **climate change, secure power, urbanization and an aging population.** 
 With the joint forces of more than 300,000 people and presence in more than 190 countries, we make a truly global impact. Together with our customers and as part of a wider ecosystem, we create bold and meaningful innovations that change the way we all live, work, make and move.
   

  

 Siemens is a proud equal opportunity employer, fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where innovation thrives, and employees prosper. Our commitment to diversity allows us to fully unleash the potential of our people. As part of our ownership culture, Siemens supports flexible working practices that empower our employees to balance work and personal commitments effectively. Read more about
 **Siemens**

title: Systemtekniker till Riksidrottsförbundet!
description:
Idrottsrörelsen är inne i en dynamisk förändringsprocess. Här drivs idrott i förening för att ha roligt, må bra och utvecklas hela livet och varje dag tar vi ännu ett steg på resan mot en mer nyfiken och välkomnande idrottsrörelse. IT-avdelningen ansvarar för att ge support till anställda och alla våra medlemsförbund samt förvaltar och utvecklar IT-miljön med fokus på säkerhet och tillgänglighet. Som System- och drifttekniker är du en viktig del i att säkerställa att idrottens medlemmar friktionsfritt kan arbeta med de digitala verktygen. Har du några års erfarenhet inom drift och är redo för nästa steg? Häng med på vår resa!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Sveriges Riksidrottsförbund
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, 100%
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Riksidrottsförbundet (RF) är idrottsrörelsens samlande organisation med uppgift att stödja, företräda, leda och samordna idrottsrörelsen i gemensamma frågor, såväl nationellt som internationellt. Riksidrottsförbundet har 72 medlemsförbund (specialidrottsförbund, SF) som tillsammans har cirka 19 000 idrottsföreningar och totalt samlar idrottsrörelsen cirka 3,3 miljoner medlemmar vilket innebär ett stort antal användare av förbundets digitala verktyg. Du kommer ett ingå i ett team om fyra personer samt din närmsta chef och ni jobbar tillsammans främst med driften av idrottens administrativa verksamhetssystem IdrottOnline, en integrationsplattform, Microsoft 365 samt den infrastruktur som krävs för den digitala arbetsplatsen. Dina kollegor finns på två olika arbetsplatser - Idrottens Hus vid Skanstull och Bosön på Lidingö. Arbete kan förekomma på bägge arbetsplatserna men du kommer främst att spendera din arbetstid på kontoret i Skanstull.
 


  


  

**Några ord från din framtida närmsta chef:**



  


 Hej, Jag heter Victoria och är IT-chef på Sveriges Riksidrottsförbund och SISU Idrottsutbildarna. När jag började här för drygt 2 år sedan möttes jag av en otroligt välkomnande och trevlig arbetsplats där alla arbetar för visionen Svensk idrott världens bästa. Digitaliseringen går snabbt och för att trivas här måste man vara lösningsfokuserad och inspireras av nya utmaningar. Inom verksamhetsområdet IT och Digital utveckling arbetar vi i nära samarbete med varandra vilket skapar en bra sammanhållning där vi både utvecklar och stöttar varandra i det dagliga arbetet och dess utmaningar. Som ledare är mitt mål att coacha och stötta mina medarbetare i att utmana sig själva och att utvecklas. Jag kommer att finnas där som bollplank för alla typer av frågor, från stöd i övergripande tekniska beslut till att hitta nya sätt att lösa utmaningar.
   

 Ta chansen och bli en del av vårt härliga team där vi tillsammans gör allt för att stötta hela Sveriges idrottsrörelse!
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Arbete i en roll där du får jobba brett med olika uppgifter inom IT-drift
  
* Arbete i organisation där det händer mycket och som är under snabb utveckling vilket vi tror kommer ge dig goda möjligheter att utvecklas i din roll
  
* En välkomnande arbetsgivare som värnar om trivsel och välmående på arbetat genom att erbjuda möjligheten till tre dagars arbete på kontor och två dagars på distans per vecka (om arbetet tillåter), 2 timmars friskvård i veckan, 3000 kr i friskvårdsbidrag per år samt lunchförmåner. Här finns också en trivselgrupp vars uppgift är att skapar det där lilla extra sociala i vardagen på jobbet!
  


  


  

**Arbetsuppgifter**



  


 Du kommer huvudsakligen jobba med att hantera driften av IT-miljön vilket innebär övervakning, installation, uppgradering, konfigurering, utveckling samt optimering av infrastrukturen för IdrottOnline, integrationsplattformen samt Microsoft 365. Detta är en roll för dig och som vill jobba brett och lära dig nya tekniker och arbetssätt. Du kommer framförallt att jobba med drift av Windowsservrar men Riksidrottsförbundet jobbar utöver det bland annat med Linux, Cisco, Meraki, Docker, Kubernetes, Prometheus, Terraform, Gravitee, ArgoCD, Curity, Microsoft Dynamics 365 m.fl. och är det områden du inte kan sedan innan så är det något du kommer få utvecklas och lära dig mer inom här!
   




**Vi söker dig som**

 I denna rekrytering kommer vi lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och intresse för tjänsten och Riksidrottsförbundet som organisation. Vi ser att du är duktig på att samarbeta, du gillar att tänka nytt och att utveckla dig själv och att ta ansvar för såväl din egen utveckling som det gemensamma resultatet i teamet.
 


  


  

**Vidare har du…**



  

  
* Minst några års erfarenhet av drift, underhåll, konfigurering och felsökning av system och nätverk
  
* Kunskaper inom Windows Server
  
* Kunskaper inom Microsoft Azure
  
* Kunskaper inom DevOps
  
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska då det är det primära arbetsspråket
  


  


  

**Vi ser det som meriterande om du också har…**



  

  
* Kunskaper inom Kubernetes
  
* Kunskaper inom SQL
  
* Kunskaper inom Microsoft 365
  


  


  

**Rekryteringsprocessen**



  

  
* Telefonintervju med Academic Work
  
* Problem- och personlighetstester
  
* Djupintervju med Academic Work
  
* Intervjuer med Riksidrottsförbundet
  
* Referenstagning + beslut
  


  


  

**Övrig information**



  

  
* Placering: Skanstull, möjlighet till visst distansarbete
  
* Start: Enligt överenskommelse
  
* Omfattning: Heltid
  
* Kontaktuppgifter: Ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Johanna Sörell, johanna.sorell@academicwork.se
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Sveriges Riksidrottsförbund**

 Läs mer om Riksidrottsförbundet på deras hemsida !
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Sveriges Riksidrottsförbund**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Johanna Sörell eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stv3@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15106090

title: Cloud Solution Architect: Security (Defender, Entra, XDR, etc.)
description:
With over 17,000 employees worldwide, the mission of the Customer Experience & Success (CE&S) organization is to empower customers to accelerate business value through differentiated customer experiences that leverage Microsoft’s products and services, ignited by our people and culture. Come join CE&S and help us build a future where customers achieve their business outcomes faster with technology that does more.
   

  

 We are looking for a Cloud Solution Architect (CSA), specializing in Security who is passionate about driving our customers’ security & AI transformation on the Microsoft Platform. This is a customer-facing role, owning the technical relationship between the customer and Microsoft, helping customers to leverage their Microsoft investments through architecture, implementation, and operational health engagements.
   

  

 Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* You will drive positive Customer Satisfaction and become a trusted advisor and provide feedback and insights from customers/partners and be the Voice of Customer to share insights and best practices, connect with Global Security teams at Microsoft, Engineering and Product teams to remove blockers and influence the solution roadmap.
* You will land an end-to-end value prop for Security (i.e., Zero Trust) which spans the breadth of Microsoft Security offerings, and with focus on Threat Protection, ID + Access Management and Cloud Security.
* You will support customers through the adoption lifecycle, through planning, adoption, deployment and optimization as you support increasing drive of Microsoft security products utilization as you lead technical solutioning and nurturing across the customer journey.
* You will deliver technical presentations & demos and propose high-level solutions and work with key Microsoft and Partner resources to drive deployment & customer adoption Identify cross sell/upsell/Unified opportunities through customer engagement.
* You will align your individual skilling to team/area demands and Customer Success goals and accelerate customer outcomes - Share expertise, contribute to IP creation & re-use to accelerate customer outcomes.
* Run Architectural Design Session to build a plan for implementing the solution – governing design in line with customer business goals and their technical environment. Outcome is consensus on solution design and next steps toward production.
* Collaborate and orchestrate with other Cloud Solution Architects and MS stakeholders including FastTrack, partner, and Microsoft Consulting in developing complex end-to-end Enterprise solutions with the Microsoft Security platform.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business, or related field AND relevant experience in cloud/infrastructure technologies, information technology (IT) consulting/support, systems administration, network operations, software development/support, technology solutions, practice development, architecture, and/or consulting
+ OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business, or related field AND relevant experience in cloud/infrastructure technologies, technology solutions, practice development, architecture, and/or consulting
+ OR equivalent experience

* Relevant experience working in a customer-facing role (e.g., internal and/or external)
* Relevant experience working on technical projects
* Technical Certification in Cloud (e.g., Azure, Amazon Web Services, Google, security certifications)
+ Threat protection, SIEM and Incident Response; Extended Detection and Response (XDR); Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR); Security Operation Center Management; Identity and Access Management; Cloud Infrastructure; Cloud Security; Data Security; Certification in one or more of the following technologies preferred: Microsoft 365 Security Administrator, Microsoft Security Operations, Cloud Security, CCSP, CEH, OSCP, GSEC.


 Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

title: Junior SAP Data Consultant
description:
Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all of these services. With our thought leadership and culture of innovation, we apply industry expertise, diverse skill sets and next-generation technology to each business challenge.
   

  

 We believe in inclusion and diversity and supporting the whole person. Our core values comprise of Stewardship, Best People, Client Value Creation, One Global Network, Respect for the Individual and Integrity. Year after year, Accenture is recognized worldwide not just for business performance but for inclusion and diversity too.
   

  

 “Across the globe, one thing is universally true of the people of Accenture: We care deeply about what we do and the impact we have with our clients and with the communities in which we work and live. It is personal to all of us.” –
 **Julie Sweet, Accenture CEO.**
**About our Nordic SAP Business Group:**
 Accenture and SAP have a longstanding relationship that extends more than 40 years. As the leading Nordic SAP transformation partner, we work with SAP end-to-end from product innovation to development and delivery. Together, we are revolutionizing the future of business through major SAP transformation programs with some of the biggest companies.
   

  

 Within our Nordic SAP community, we work with the newest SAP solutions and offerings such as SAP S/4 HANA Cloud, SAP CX, Ariba, SuccessFactors, SAP BTP and SAP RISE.
   

  

 We are now looking to expand our community at scale and are looking for candidates on several positions and seniority levels.
   

  

 To read more about our SAP Practice, visit us at https://www.accenture.com/us-en/services/sap-index
   

  

**SAP Data Nordic Value Tower:**
 Within the SAP Value Tower Data, we offer you the opportunity to work with SAP Data and to grow your knowledge within the area of Information Management, connected to SAP MDG, Master Data Management and Data Migration.
   

  

 We are looking for people who have a genuine interest in Data, want to grow and challenge themselves within that area and work with the best skilled colleagues.
   

  

**Role Overview:**
 As a junior SAP Data Consultant in Accenture’s Nordic SAP Business Group, you will be an integral part of our team supporting our clients SAP transformation projects through acting as a Functional Expert in the Data Migration and/or Data Governance areas. You will work closely with clients, translating their business and functional requirements into SAP design documents and overseeing solution delivery.
   

  

**Example project roles:**
- Advise clients on their data transformation strategies, driving value creation through the positioning of SAP enabled solutions as well as leading solutions from SAP partners and Accenture

- Be part of the data migration stream of an S/4HANA transformation, working with colleagues in delivery centers to execute on their data transformation and data upload strategies

- Work with clients on their transformational journey, by implementing Master Data Governance strategy and processes, following SAP best practices and Accenture’s proven ways of working

**What’s in it for you:**
- Help Accenture deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity

- Be part of our culture and core values in a truly human work environment

- Take part in our highly engaged and diverse global network, for collaboration and delivery

- Enjoy competitive compensation and benefits

- Develop your skills and build an extraordinary career

- Grab significant development and training opportunities to develop your business acumen, consulting toolbox, technical and professional skills

- Get internal coaching, support and guidance from a mentor, to progress in your work and professional career with continuous feedback

- Gain access to comprehensive tools and frameworks supported by our global organization, including implementation methodologies, knowledge databases, industry leading add-on software, expert networks and benchmarks

- Combine business consulting skills with technology strategy know-how

- Transform businesses with the newest technologies and making them data-driven companies

- Work with some of the biggest SAP clients in large global implementation projects

- Be an integral part of innovative SAP transformation projects

- Play a key role in transforming organizations and communities around the world. Let there be change!

**Qualifications**
**Must have:**
- Deep interest in the importance of Data

- Passion about innovation and delivery of the latest technologies to your clients

- Strong resonance with Accenture’s values

- Motivation, persistence, eagerness to optimize and drive for excellence

- Strong analytical skills, result-oriented paired with highly structured working style and good sense of responsibility, flexibility and to be a team player

- Willingness and ability to quickly learn new concepts and technologies

- Eagerness to shape and work in a team-oriented environment

- Strong will to pursue a problem, identify the source and propose possible solutions in collaboration with other team members in a timely manner

- Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills to address technical and non-technical audiences in English

- Nordic (Danish, Norwegian, Swedish or Finnish) language spoken

- A Bachelor or Master’s degree

**Very nice to have:**
- Experience with Data Migration and/or Data Governance

- Previous exposure to or user of SAP

- Knowledge in a functional or business process area

- Technical development (programming) background

**Locations**
 Gothenburg, Malmö, Stockholm
   

  

 Thank you for your interest in joining Accenture. Due to the summer holiday season, our response times might be a bit longer than usual. Please note that we will review your application in the beginning of August and get back to you shortly after.

title: Head of Tableau, EMEA North - Sr RVP, Sales (2nd Line)
description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*
 Job Category
   

  

 Sales
   

  

 Job Details
   

  

**About Salesforce**
 We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.
   

  

**About Tableau, a Salesforce Company**
*Tableau Software (a Salesforce company) is a company on a mission. We help people see and understand their data. After a highly successful IPO in 2013, Tableau has become a market-defining company in the business intelligence industry and based on this success was acquired by Salesforce in 2019. Our analytics platform fuels exploration, allowing customers to quickly answer questions with data and share insights across your organization. Global enterprises, early-stage startups, nonprofits, and governments all use Tableau’s intuitive software to quickly transform their data into actionable insights. We are passionate about our product and our mission, and we are loyal to each other and our company. We value work/life balance, efficiency, simplicity, friendly customer service, and making a difference in the world!*
 An opportunity exists in our Tableau Sales organisation for a Regional Leader looking to further their career in a hyper-growth, fast-paced and dynamic environment! We are seeking an exceptional and ambitious 2nd line Sales Manager who will play a key role in driving strategic, Tableau sales initiatives for the Benelux and Nordics regions.
   

  

**Role Description**
 As a Regional Leader, you will play a key role leading a team of highly visible and motivated Sales Managers and Sales Executives in our expanding Tableau North sales operation that generates revenue and achieves individual, team and organisational quotas. You will also play a key role in developing our channel and run marketing to raise the market positioning of Tableau in the region to a new level. Our culture is a pivotal element of our success at Salesforce so your leadership will encompass strong energy, passion and the ability to lead a dynamic workforce. Ideal candidates should possess solid business-to-business (B2B) sales and prior Enterprise Sales management experience.
   

  

**Your Impact**
 Development of a growing and diverse team who are seen as trusted advisors to our customer(s) and with internal team members
   

  

 Execute and develop Go-To-Market (GTM) strategy for the team to increase our market share and fuel the expansion of Tableau across the region
   

  

 Supporting Account Executives by participating and leading in client meetings and engaging other teams as required
   

  

 Management of a high performance team with a high focus on Quarterly Quota Attainment, including recruiting, hiring and training
   

  

 Manage a reliable business with high forecast accuracy and accountability
   

  

 Help build a strong sales channel and North region-specific marketing activities with the Channel and Marketing teams
   

  

 Driving pipeline generation initiatives to improve revenue generating opportunities for the customer account(s)
   

  

 Build strong team unity, internal connections, and collaboration across the Salesforce eco-system
   

  

 Mentor and professionally develop Account Executives regarding strategies to ensure a high level of closure rates and opportunity identification
   

  

 Engaging at the C-level in customer organisations
   

  

 Accurate reporting on sales activity and forecasting to Area Sales Management
   

  

 Consistently supervising and enhancing the sales activities of the team
   

  

 Be an enabler of an inclusive and winning team spirit
   

  

**Required Skills**
* Consistent track record in building / managing high performance teams and achieving quarterly targets
* 2nd-line Management experience (Managing Managers) preferred
* Developing a strong presence in a market including sales, channel, marketing strategy
* Able to operate and navigate successfully in a matrix / multi-product sales environment
* A passion for and/or knowledge of selling Business Intelligence / Data Analytics solutions
* Experience selling transformational technology solutions to major Enterprise customers and Commercial Businesses
* Extensive experience in solution sales (especially Software / SaaS / Cloud) from Demand Generation to Closing
* People management experience, including accountable performance management
* Proven ability to create, grow and inspire successful teams
* Excellent interpersonal skills; able to inspire and build trusted relationships (internally and externally)
* Passion for supporting team development, as well as for their own self-improvement
* A self-starter that can excel in a fast-paced environment
* Degree or equivalent relevant experience required. Experience will be evaluated based on the core competencies for the role (e.g. extracurricular leadership roles, military experience, volunteer roles, work experience, etc.)


**Benefits & Perks**
 Check out our benefits site which explains our various benefits, including well-being reimbursement, generous parental leave, adoption assistance, fertility benefits, and more
   

  

 Accommodations
   

  

 If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.
   

  

 Posting Statement
   

  

 At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more.
